Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Hilton for several days. The hotel is very clean and seems new. The only issue we had is the sloooow elevators. A few tips--you can easily walk to Gaslamp or the waterfront attractions. You can always take a cab or pedicab back to the hotel.. Easy access to the trolley if you want to visit other attractions. The lounge is good with a nice selection of hand made cocktails. Pool areas and outdoor fire pits are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: VacationBound57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located across from the Gas Lamp area and trolley line. Very easy to get around San Diego. Exercise facilities in hotel were great! Hot tub and pool - beautiful. Staff was very attentive - great stay!

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: A newer hotel right on the Bayfront with a great view of the Coronado Bridge. Easy access to the Seaport Village. Right across the street from the convention center and Petco Park. Within walking distance of the Historic Gaslamp district. The hotel itself is fairly new and very clean. The rooms were large and luxurious. The beds and pillows are very comfy. There are plenty of food options on location. There is a very nice heated pool and hot tub that were even open in December! There was nice outdoor seating area with fire pits near the pool. Don't have a beer at the hotel bar, go to Fox Sports Bar located on the lower level by the pool, its half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with good location and service.”
Reviews.Author: seba007
Reviews.Content: I stayed two times in the hotel during business trips. It have all the services, a very good breakfast and the personnel is very nice. It is located a few blocks to the Gaslamp District with lot of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention hotel, some tweaking needed”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel adjoining the convention center and their rates are surprisingly reasonable. The good - clean, large rooms, fairly soundproof. Front desk is efficient but not particularly friendly. Some bell staff made up for that lack. However, be aware the port side Coronado view rooms overlook a working container port and ships are loaded mostly on Sunday through Tuesday. They are supposed to stop at 10 PM but were going till 2 AM our first night. Bring your earplugs. Although the hotel works well, because of it's size, there can be lines for the elevators, and meal facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no lounge”
Reviews.Author: ahu98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new. We have been upgraded to a two Queen bed room, but can't really tell the difference about the room (higher level maybe). There is no lounge in the hotel and the breakfast is Starbucks drink and one food item.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in every category!”
Reviews.Author: Sharkswave
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayfront was in the perfect location, very clean and had helpful and friendly service. The valet was very quick to respond as soon as you walked or drove up. The front desk employee's were prompt and friendly. The bell hops always greeted you and asked if they assist you with anything. The hotel grounds, elevator's and room's were very clean. The various restaurants and on site Starbuck's were clean, had a nice selection and the service was fast. You are also across the street from the Gas Lamp Quarter which is "the" place find good food and bars. The pool and hot tub was very clean. I did not use the spa, so I cannot comment on them. I did call to inquire about a massage and they were very friendly and helpful over the phone. During my Christmas stay the hotel did something new. The chef mad a very large chocolate display in the main lobby and smaller displays throughout the hotel. To satisfy your curiosity, they had unlimited samples of all three types of chocolates used in the displays and it was very good quality. This is my second time staying at this hotel. The service, from my experience, is consistently great. As a Hilton Honors Gold VIP member I was given a free daily breakfast at Starbucks ( "any" drink and breakfast item of your choice), a free daily tasting from one of the restaurants and two free bottle of water. The only thing you should be concerned about is the high occupancy of both adults and children. The hallways got a little loud from time to time. The hotel is very close to the convention center and Petco Field. All the doors slam pretty loud.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: JayNZ63
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Bayfront. Great views, quiet and relaxing. Great place to go for runs and get exercise. A bit of a walk to other restaurants in town but views made it worthwhile. Was very glad we purchased hotel package which included parking, breakfast and Internet as otherwise these are expensive add-ons. We had connecting rooms with our teenagers and worked well. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Priced High End Property in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JC W
Reviews.Content: I vacation in San Diego a few times a year and you can't beat this new, sleek, resort-style property - Its biggest draw includes its spacious, modern design and its resort pool area that's right on the waterfront; as well as the vast, park-like area that surrounds the hotel -- yet you are also so close to the shopping and restaurants of the Gaslamp district. Another great thing I found is the price-value, compared to other quality properties in San Diego, it just can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Rooms, CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: whocareswhoiam
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really nice, and clean clean clean. Bedding is comfy. The bathrooms are fresh and clean. Nice showers. Amenities are great, although we did have to call and request them along with bathrobes - as none were in our room when we arrived. The staff is efficient and friendly, responsive. The walkway to Petco Park and downtown is convenient. Easy walk to the convention center. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Parking, however, is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel on the edge of the gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: azgal_33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a family vacation. The hotel really stepped up and honored an internet rate package that offered via Hilton.com in error ($99/night + free parking +$35/night hotel credit to be used in anyway we liked!). The breakfast buffet is great - kids ate free with adult purchase, I highly recommend. The rooms were comfortable enough and staff was friendly. You have to walk across a bridge over the road to get to the Gaslamp, trolley, or really anything, but that was a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: srilankanqueen
Reviews.Content: I actually checked out of the hotel today. I was there for two nights. The hotel is very clean and nice. The hotel is less than a min away from the convention center. U can basically walk to the gaslamp distict. The room has great beds. The bathroom was very clean. The room was carpeted. The parking was a little expensive, its $27.00 a night. I booked thru Expedia, so all the taxes and everything was taken care of. I def would recommend and come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with the best location ever”
Reviews.Author: Medoz
Reviews.Content: Great location... Only 3 minutes walk from Gaslam str. And downtown... Exactly beside the convention center.. Clean rooms, very comfortable pellows and beds..great view .. Excellent food and room service.. I strongly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “newish, convenient, and just out of the fray”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: This hotel has sprung up over the last few years since my last convention visit to San Diego. It's quite nice and modern, with quite reasonably-sized rooms. The bathroom counter was very spacious (always annoying when there's not enough room for your toiletries). Perhaps the only negative was the somewhat less than luxurious shower spray. Not that it was a drip or insufficient (and I'm all for water conservation), but it seemed just a litle on the narrow or weakish side given the room in the tub/shower (with the amply curved "american-style" shower rod). But it was workable. I declined the extra $20/night for a "view" room of the bay and downtown, but my view from an upper floor was fine (down to the pool and spa area, the Dole shipping facility next door, water, and the bridge to Coronado). I had been expecting a wall or alley view... The location was great. Just on the "far side" of the convention center (bascially crossing the street from one end and you're there), across the street and tracks from Petco stadium and 10 min to the Gaslamp district etc. It takes 15-20 min to walk the length of the convention center to get to the Marriot Marquis and Manchester Hyatt on the other side. Being on the edge of the downtown/convention area zone, it was the perfect balance of convenience, but also less hectic. And whoever thought of putting bumps on a bar of soap and labeling it a "massage bar" is a marketing genius...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, very nice hotel. It is next to everything--convention center, gaslamp district, the bay...on and on. Parking is very expensive, but, easy to selfpark. Very close to the airport, but, I experienced no disturbance on the 20th floor. I also had beautful views of the bay and the bridge going across. I can't imagine that there any bad views in this hotel, after you are high enough up. The hotel is new and very state of the art with regard to amenities--HDTV, channels, check-in reception area, restuarants are very california-ish. I just find the food better in the south and the east! Only complaint was they were extremely slow at checking people in. I believe there was a medical conference going on while I was there, and they did not seem to staff for the large crowds. I also had to return to the reception desk to get a "ticket" for breakfast. They would not let you in without one. It was probably a good thing because I discovered that I was entitled to free breakfast when I was prepared to pay. The hotel is very impressive, and in an excellent location. I think you could probably walk to many attractions from there. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great "resort" hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Samhope
Reviews.Content: I was at the Bayfront for a conference this past week and it is a great business hotel. All the amenities you need during a conference - large rooms, nice bathrooms and walking distance to the Gaslamp district. The best part besides the great service is the large array of TV channels (awesome when you are away from home) and a Starbucks that opens at 6am. The hotel has a resort feel so I can imagine it would be great for vacation as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: P.Jordan
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up we were greeted with smiles and excellent service. We checked in Thanksgiving day to be near family for the holiday. Registration was a breeze with Jorge at check in. He is friendly, helpful and there with a smille when you have questions or concerns. Thanks Jorge and thank you John for all the help with lugguage and settling in and out of our room with the view of the city and the sea . He is the best. Enjoyed the fantastic Thanksgiving buffet - 11 of us. Again great service and very helpful staff. Breakfast in the morning was delicious - we chose to order from the menu but many were enjoying the buffet, Beds are so comfortable - and of course the hotel just about sits on the water so the view is the best. There is a green area just outside the hotel and we saw kids and families playing touch football and croquet. Thank you for making our holiday a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and the hotel is beautiful. The lobby is great and the rooms are very nice. The bed, as with all Hilton hotels, was divine! The location is outside of the Gaslamp and does require a decent walk across a bridge or a quick cab ride. Don't be fooled into thinking that this is in the Gaslamp. Also, we had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs and the service was very slow. The food was decent and the views were great. But, service was very very slow. I would recommend this hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Hilton where I stayed as part of my company's global sales conference. My overall rating for this property is "Excellent." (I use four star reviews to reflect great stays that are not at world-class, luxury levels.). The rooms are really nice. Totally new feel, comfortable beds, very functional (not mega-luxury by any means, but very satisfying. The common areas are very nice as well. We used two levels of the convention space and the property feels new and works very well for large-scale conferences. Convention food was fine. I don't think that you can review a hotel based on serving 900 people. It's just not a fair comparison. One note of precaution... We often travel with our kids to San Diego for vacation (this was not one of those trips), but I would not recommend this property for a trip with children. While there is harbor access, there is no beach access. The location is central to many attractions, the property itself is somewhat landlocked by access roads. But if this is a business trip -- particularly one where you need access to the convention center and would like easy walking distance to both the ball park and Gas Lamp District, the Hilton is an outstanding choice.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here! Be warned!”
Reviews.Author: Judith W
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a month in advance as my husband is here for travel for work and my two kids and I decided to tag along and make it a fun trip as well. After driving a good few hours from LA to the hotel, we were excited to check in as we are Hilton Honors members and often stay at the Hilton hotels when we travel. Well, never again! We unloaded our luggage and our two young kids and then at check in were informed by the front desk that they were sorry but there were NO rooms available! They did have confirmation that I had booked, but all they said was they were sorry but there was nothing they could do?!? I asked to speak to the front desk manager and was told the same thing and the reason she only gave me was that sometimes people refuse to leave when they are suppose to check out?! I was so upset as I had just received confirmation welcoming our arrival from Hilton San Diego Bay front a week ago. After I voiced my concerns over not being guaranteed a room when you book a month in advance and then having to pack up with my kids she offered ONE free night hotel stay at a neighbouring hotel and that was the best she could offer. I was told I could pay the rest of my nights at that hotel or check back in with them the next day. Why would I unpack all my belongings after one night and drive back to that hotel with two young kids? My husband is here for work and would need to leave early in the am. I cannot believe that such a large and respectable hotel chain would do that to a customer who booked and got an e-mail confirmation a week before the check in day. They also never attempted to e-mail or call me (they had my contact info) before the actual check in day to tell me that they had no room for me anymore. I am so shocked as we have travelled and stayed at many hotels both for business and pleasure and never once have heard of this happening. Upon check in at the suggested hotel (we had to leave to have a hotel to stay for the night) they did confirm that this has happened with Hilton San Diego bayfront before as well. Interesting....I think it is not an honest mistake but they oversell the number of rooms they have on purpose. It is a disappointing experience as prior to this happening we were even thinking of purchasing a Hilton vacations club in the future. I just hope you think twice before booking as you don't want to be surprised with no room upon check in. I usually never comment on trip advisor but have sought advice from travellers here myself and thought it was important enough to warn fellow travellers. Just be careful. There are plenty of new and better service hotels in San Diego that are worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “So choice...if you have the means”
Reviews.Author: Kid_Dynamite
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two different occasions, each for 3+ nights. The hotel is spectacular, but you are going to pay for it. Beds were great, room was nice, but nothing that would just blow you away. The main thing here is the hotel itself. Very large & beautiful. Great stay if you are doing something at the convention center next door. Easy walk to the Gas Lamp district. Joes Crab shack is just right behind the building, which is highly recommended. The hotel does have nice bars & food inside, though again, pricey. I would certainly stay here again, especially when my company is paying for it!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: agcpa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of October for a business conference. My impression was generally of a crowded, cold, almost impersonal establishment, and a pricey one at that. It was the first hotel that we have been at that could not honor a reservation request for a king bed, pointedly emphasizing that the request was just that, merely a request. It's one singular plus is its location; next to the convention center, the gaslamp district, and the ball park. If that location is not important to you, I would seriously consider looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: E C
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal, right on the bay and within walking distance of Seaport, Gaslamp district and right across from the Convention Center. Although, the lobby and restaurant areas seem to be really hopping in the evening, the rest of the hotel is remarkably sound insulated. The room was comfortable and the bed was too. Great bay view from the window! (I am not a Hilton member and was not even asked if I wanted a bay view, so that was a nice surprise.) Staff were all pleasant and helpful. I was not crazy about having to pay for time in the business center to use the computer, but no charge for printing boarding passes. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Escape From The OC”
Reviews.Author: AnaheimHillsDucati
Reviews.Content: My wife, and I have been "escaping" the OC maddness by making weekend runs to San Diego for several years now. We used to stay at various hotels, like the US Grant, the Westins, Emerald Plaza & Horton Plaza, and on ocassion at the Hilton Bayfront. We finally stopped changing hotels, because of the beds at the Hilton. They are really comfortable, and when I want to relax I need a great bed. It is also nice that all the rooms have a nice view of the bay, on one side the Coronado Bridge or the other the Aircraft Carrier Midway. We never eat at the Hilton, as 5th Street & the gas lamp are a short 10 minute walk from the hotel. We make reservations through Expedia, or Travelocity, and the per night cost is usually around $160.00 night during the off season. The Hilton is a nice place, I will be back there in January. AH Ducati

Reviews.Title: “nice but . .”
Reviews.Author: marc h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a recent visit to San Diego for a convention. As is the case with most Hilton Hotels, the public areas were beautiful. Staff were helpful in all areas. However, when you're paying $249/night plus taxes, one should not have to pay $4.25 for a bottle of water left in the room nor should one have to pay between $6.95 (one hour) and $19.95 (24 hours with high-speed) for in-room internet service. Stayed at a LaQuinta Inn and Suites last Christmas for $79/night plus taxes and got a nice room, complimentary water and internet service included in the cost of the room and a great continental breakfast every morning. So, if you want a nice view and need to be close to the convention center, stay here. If those things aren't important and/or necessary,there are other hotels in the city that provide more services for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “generally ok but occasional long queues”
Reviews.Author: evelyninhouston
Reviews.Content: first off, great location especially if you have a sea facing room, but heres my first niggle: after a long wait to check in (I was in the VIP line as I am a HiltonHonors silver card holder) I was asked if i wanted a "room with a view" for only an extra $20 per day - annoyingly. colleagues of mine who are not HH members were given similar rooms for free!! the next morning we were told there was a 20 - 30 minute wait for breakfast when we could see plenty of empty tables, i.e. they were understaffed. but a too small fitness centre where they wanted to charge $4 for ear phones - How annoying is that?? I much prefer the Manchester Hyatt just up the road. Apart from that, no complaints and a generally good hotel to stay in,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: BikeHawk
Reviews.Content: Was at conference in November 2011. Hotel did a wonderful job - view of San Diego Bay is magnificant and the ability to easily step outside form conference rooms during breaks was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views”
Reviews.Author: norcalman95628
Reviews.Content: While I stayed here on business, the location is perfect for vacationing/holidy travelers as it is in walking distance of the Gaslamp District, Petco Park, and the views are stunning. The room was immaculate, bedding hig-quality. It is also in walking distance of the convention center so a great option for business travelers going to functions there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Oahu4us
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms were spacious and clean. Bathrooms actually had drawers so you could keep the counter tops clear. Typical area parking fees, people who complain just plain have never stayed in a resort area with limited parking, deal with it. Fairly new bridge over to the Gaslamp district, beautiful at night. Crosses over right at Petco park. Hotel bar - also typical, expensive drinks. Sports bar downstairs good place to catch a game and bite to eat. Suggest walking over to Seaport villiage and eating breakfast at Buster's Beach House & Longboard Bar. Also a fun place to drink later, great decor and Island drinks. Short walk out the back of the hotel. Gaslamp district, plenty of places to eat - lots of chains, Ruth Chris, McCormick & Schmidts, Hard Rock, House of Blues, Dicks Last Resort, etc. but you can find, and I would suggest trying the locals. Really enjoyed Nickey Rottens burgers - everything is 100% organic, good food and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Marine Corps Birthday Ball celebration 11/12/11”
Reviews.Author: Camaro_Guy_5
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of traveling over the years and this room was average at best. After we checked into my first room ( the Garage for Parking) this was exspensive. there is no "on site" parking for the Hotel. Just vallet or the parking garage next to the hotel. If you Vallet, tey park your car in the garage next door. They have contract with a local parking garage. over night stay is $27. and it's your only choice. The check-in process was easy. staff was friendly at first. once I asked about validatign tehe parking, the desk pretty much told me I was on my own and they don't validate. Ok enough about the parking.. The room rate was $159. like I said I have stayed in many hotels and I would have thought that for this price and being the "Hilton" the rooms would have been alot nicer wad a little bigger than a Motel 6 room. Cleanliness: The room was dated and the carpets could definately be replaced. the bathroom counters were granite!. Granite being porus does hold moisture and MOLD was growing.Definaely need to reseal the counter tops. Bed were 2 Queens. At least that what we were told. Smallest queen beds I have ever slept in. The room temp was stayed some where between vagas in August and death valley in June! could not get teh temp to come down. Hilto bay Front with a view!!!! yeah right a view of the Dole ship yard and the underside of the Coronado bridge! Everything in this place was OVER PRICED. $4.50 bottle of water $4 Coke. come on, I realize it's a hotel but really? This was for the Marine Corp Birthday Ball. after we taste tested and confirmed the food choice, they still messed this up. $58 for a meal which amounted to about 4oz a steak and 4oz chicken breast, Litterally 1 baby Carrot and 1 asparagus spear and 2 small pices of squash. Hilton Hotels received over $55K from us last night and I a pretty sure it will be the last they will ever receive from my unit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: apple_tini80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days during CTIA in October. The hotel is at an awesome location. It's right by the water, convention center, and a short walk to the gas lamp district. The bar and lounge is very nice. Staff was really friendly and helpful - I forgot to bring toothpaste and they brought one up for me right away. The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds were also super comfy. It's also about a 10 minute drive to the airport. This is a good hotel to stay at whether you are in San Diego for business or for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kev1438
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel near the Convention Center and San Diego Airport. It rises around 30 stories tall and has great views north and south and across the bay to Coronado Island. The views really sell the rooms, especially those looking out across to the Island and the Pacific Ocean beyond. The rooms are nice, typical Hilton, the bathrooms a bit disappointing because those with King Beds lack tubs. Service was great. Maintenance came up and fixed a problem with my air conditioning system (it was making a strange noise) and check-in was easy. Restaurants are mainly down on the bottom floor and it is a hike to the Starbuck's on the property. The hotel has a good gym and business center.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room but Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: califdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location however you may not have the greatest view. Our room had a partial view of the Coronado Bridge which was nice but also a bigger view of the truck yard .The room was clean but very small and basic. No refrigerator and no microwave. Since I was there for a convention the rate was cheap enough but if I had not had a special rate it would have been about 350 per night and it definately was not worth that.The location was good with access to a nice walking area along the bay and not far from the Gas Lamp District and across from the Petco Stadium. The staff was very,very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “View of the port :(”
Reviews.Author: Owlisn
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here instead of the Hotel Indigo based on the price, as I got a room for $80. The bay view was nice, but I was not crazy about seeing the loading dock for the cargo ship right next to my room and that was supposed to be an upgraded room. The hotel was nice and as tired as my feed were, the $30 for valet was well worth it. The room itself was very nice and spacious. I did have a problem with the alarm clock which caused me to miss my flight. Food was good and I really liked the atmosphere in the bar. I agree with another reviewer that the check in/out process was not very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Andy Hayler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference I was attending. It is a large hotel, though the room I had was fine. The bell staff were particularly helpful. There is a decent, though, busy gym, that often was packed out even before 7 a.m. one day. Its location is fine, and there is a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: toodogsus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-long stay at the Bayfront for a convention and was just as impressed as I was a year ago on my first stay. The staff is attentive, friendly, and plentiful. The design is boutique--if they blindfolded you and dropped you off in the lobby, you'd swear you're at a W or a Kimpton. The food is excellent, from catered events for 1,000+ to the restaurants to room service. The food service staff takes great pride in their work--Marjie was our server for several events and she was enthusiastic and informative about the menu and couldn't do enough to make our guests comfortable. The gym is well-equipped, clean, and opens at 5:30. Several colleagues swam each morning in the outdoor heated pool overlooking the Bay. Best of all, the rooms are quiet and beautiful, with comfortable beds and nice linens. The view can't be beat! Having traveled widely for business (and to San Diego many times), it takes a lot to impress me and I think this is one of the best meetings properties I've experienced. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: waylward
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only three years oild and is ideally located next to the convention center and the popular Gaslamp District which is accessed by crossing a bridge directly from the hotel. The hotel has an excellent breakfast buffet, and the wait and bar staff are very good. Erin, Travis,Jennifer, Melanie among others. Also helpful Concierge and greeting staff. Oddly our room was not serviced twice during our stay for which management apologized. We stayed a week. Bay view wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gregm3367
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for a trade show. If you are going to a trade show at the convention center it's a perfect location. It is also extremely close to the Gas Lamp District and the view from the Bay View rooms are fantastic. Get a corner room up high, it's worth it! The hotel is modern and clean, the pool and hot tub are great! Didn't eat at the retaurants although I know someone who did who said the food was mediocre and expensive. There are a ton of food options in the Gas Lamp Section just fifteen minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious views!”
Reviews.Author: Ali24
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here! It is a huge hotel and is right next to a conference centre, so there are lots of people milling around from the conference - however the views are lovely and the surrounding area is delightful to walk around and you are so near to the gaslamp area to walk in and get a good meal very easily and without parking. Also the beautiful Coronado Island is very near and has a fabulous beach! The staff were very nice and the pool area was lovely -not sure why they need loud thumping music round the pool though - but every hotel we stayed in on the West coast seemed to do the same so maybe thats a Californian thing!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Convention Center Hotel-It's OK and What You Expect”
Reviews.Author: smrpenn
Reviews.Content: First off, chances are huge that you'll stay here for biz/conference. It's right next to the convention center, next to the also huge Marriott Marquis and Hyatt, and you really won't have to leave it during most business matters. It's also very convenient to the airport and has a great location overlooking the Bay. It's walking distance for your biz dinners/events in the Gaslamp. The rooms are blasÃ©, you can get a great view and that's about it. Not much in terms of character, but like I said, if you want character and all that jazz...simply try out other hotels in the Gaslamp. Would I stay here again? Well, after the Hyatt, Marriott and some others depending upon where my meetings are, or if I'm here for fun. If you're here for fun, don't bother. Otherwise, it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Visitor91931
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Inn on the San Diego Bay waterfront for our anniversary and had a room vith a view of both Coronado and the downtown skyline, as well as the San Diego Harbor. I asked for a low level floor but wished we had requested a higher floor for the added view. The room was a bit pricey plus they charged $27 or one night of parking so our stay for one night cost $342 which included a buffet breakfast for two. The location was close enough to walk to restaurants near Seaport Village (about a 20 minute walk) and right next to a new pedestrian bridge that was built for the Padres Petco Ballpark access and access to the Gaslamp District (about a 15 minute walk). The pool was really nice (billed as the largest saltwater pool in San Diego). The bar was OK and had outdoor seating. The two restaurants at the hotel looked comfortable but we only had breakfast at the one with the buffet. The buffet was OK but the hot food was cold by the time I got to the table. The service was not great (the waitress was nowhere to be found). This hotel is perfect for the San Diego Convention Center meetings because it is right nextdoor. We went to Joe's Crab Shack for dinner as it was only a 10 minute walk along the bayfront where they are just completing construction of the waterfront "boardwalk" that connects the hotel to the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Windswept_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early September - for less than $100 a night (inc breakfast) this hotel proved to be outstanding value. In fact, I can't think of another hotel that comes close of providing the facilities/services this Hilton offered for that price. Transfers from the hotel are available, but you'll probably end up needing a rental if you're heading out of the downtown area, so you may as well pick up the car at the airport and drive the 10 mins to the hotel - it's not a difficult route and there is amble self-parking available (but the parking garage layout can be a little confusing). It seems a bit odd that in order to access some of the amenities (sports bar, starbucks, etc) you have to leave the hotel, walk round a corner, and enter from the outside. Then repeat the exercise to back into the hotel. Not a major trauma, but its a bit bemusing that you can't access them from inside like you can the cocktail bar and restaurant. A quick walk over the bridge delivers you to the Gaslamp area and more restaurants/bars that you'll probably ever need and catering to every budget and preference. If you just want to stretch your legs then the waterfront is right outside and you can wander along looking at various floating maritime attractions. Breakfast is good, with an amble buffet and portions from the menu are sufficient to see you through the morning (and maybe more!). Food at the Fox sports bar is perfectly acceptable, if somewhat predictable, but then it's a sports bar so you know exactly what's what. Rooms are clean and tidy, sensibly sized, the same can be said for the bathroom. Higher floors have better views, and if you plan to spend time looking out the window then opt for one overlooking the bridge rather than the container docks. The higher up you go the less noise is apparent and there's little need to close the curtains - no one can look in - and if you're not fussed at the scenery then save yourself the extra $ charged for the bridge view and stare out the window at nothing in particular from the comfort of the bed. I'm sure it's an endless source of amusement to the check-in staff as bemused guests wander around the lobby looking for the elevators that take you to the floor you're looking for - it isn't immediately obvious. Will be using this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs at the San Diego Bayfront Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Jake T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Diego Bayfront Hilton for an executive conference in mid-October 2011. On my third night of a three night stay, I awoke to bed bugs on the pillows of the bed. The hotel staff let me know there had been other reports of bed bugs in the hotel. A nice hotel, but use caution.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: michael f
Reviews.Content: While stating at the hotel , we were apart of the Eufora convention The staff was just so helpful I would especially like to thank the Banquet setup guys Jeff and Ronnie for helping us out whenever we needed anything. I would Like to give a Big thank you to Ronnie from banquet setup he found my I phone and immediately turned it in to our lost in found. He was also very helpful in telling us about some of the history of San Diego from the star of India to the u.s.s midway and about historic old town San Diego. Cant wait until next year to experience the Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: sunhshine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in this fantastic hotel. We are so glad we chose it and when we return to San Diego we will def return. So much has been said in previous reviews and I have to agree with all the positive comments - I have nothing negative to say. Loved - the amazing view from the 25th floor / superb breakfast / pool area with large outdoor tv and cabanas with personal tv's / it is so well looked after and immaculate / friendly staff / brilliant location. We honestly could not have chosen to stay anwhere better!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Lynnpatricia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and felt very happy with our choice. We loved the fact that it is a little out of the main centre (but within easy walking distance) and right on the bay. We upgraded by 20 dollars per day for a better view over the bay and city skyline. Nice room, great view, clean and modern with comfy bed. Didn't use the pool but it looked lovely. The only let down is the service which is patchy. At the bar in Vela the staff were disinterested, gum chewing and unprofessional. The staff in the restaurant were pleasant enough but there were not enough of them. This was a pity as the food was good and deserved service to match. This was also true of the concierge service which was very hit and miss. Check your bill. We had a "fall fun" package which included 35 dollars per day spend which had not been taken off our bill. Take a Flagship harbour cruise early on in your stay as it is well worthwhile and is a pleasant way to get orientated. Also do visit USS Midway for a fantastic day out. Overall a great stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Outstanding views, Great Location, needs better service”
Reviews.Author: TGU-ORD
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel with new rooms. Outstanding views! Nice, new, clean, functional. Located across convention center, short walk to gaslamp quarter where you can find plenty of nightlife and restaurants, across baseball field, near marina and pleasant stroll to parks, tourist area, 10 minute $15 cab ride to airport, so what more can I say about its incredible location. As Hilton Honors my upgrade was to a high floor, water view. I was also given a certificate for afternoon snack and drink at bar, a certificate for credit at restaurant for continental breakfast (you can pay up the difference if you want full breakfast) or use the credit for starbucks on site, I chose starbucks and ate my breakfast outside! Enjoyed stay. Did wait a lot for service at bar.

Reviews.Title: “No need for a car.”
Reviews.Author: EyeLoveExcursions
Reviews.Content: Good location. Friendly staff. Mattress not the best. Nice fitness room & pool.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay on the bay!”
Reviews.Author: Honeycats
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Hilton Bayfront you are greeted by a modern, soothing aquatic theme. This property boasts amazing city and bay views and an awesome pool. The good: -friendly staff -good sized rooms -tasteful decor -gorgeous views -comfortable outdoor spaces -great pool The bad: -the bar (overpriced, understaffed, ran out of ingredients for signature drinks) Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Atlaseee
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when on business travel and I love the location and the view from the room. The Starbucks in the hotel is one of the best things. Hilton Honors members get vouchers to Starbucks, which makes my morning. The rooms are new and clean. It's my favorite Hilton in the States. Wish they had fridges in the rooms and parking was cheaper, but it is downtown San Diego and on the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: CR88
Reviews.Content: New hotel. Stayed in a standard room. Furnishings were modern and clean. Bed was a little soft for me but comfortable. Nice views. Only one restaurant for breakfast which cannot handle the crowd when there is a convention/meeting at the hotel. Self parking lot is close, convenient, abundant and easily accessible to hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “VIEWS OVER THE BAY”
Reviews.Author: MeppyAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful hotel for 5 nights less than a month ago. the hotel is fairly new, and all the appointments (room, internet availability, helpfulness of staff, including Concierge) excellent. We had a view over the lawn, from which we could view a wedding taking place at the weekend, and also over the Bay. This hotel was cheaper than the Embassy Suites closer to downtown which is why we chose it, but also within walking distance of the Midway, and the Gaslamp District. Would stay there again if we returned to San Diego. My husband as there for business, while I enjoyed myself wandering around the district. On his day off we did the Hop-onHop-off bus tour, something I try to do in most cities as it is a great way to see and hear of all the highlights of a place. We also toured the Midway which my husband enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel in San Diego with Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachTripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront in October, 2011. We had taken the Amtrak down from LA so that it would feel like a real getaway. The downtown Trolley took us from Santa Fe train depot to the "Gaslamp" stop, which was a short walk from the hotel. The hotel is very modern, with sleek lines and large, open spaces. The atmosphere is a little cold because of the modern style, but that is made up for by the warm customer service. At check-in, the lady at the front desk was friendly and professional. I had booked a Bay-City view King room, and I requested a room with more of a bay view, if one was available. She assigned us to Room 1602, which was on the very end of the hotel, overlooking San Diego Bay. What an amazing view! (See the picture I took from my window.) Our room was immaculately clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom had gorgeous lighting, and the water pressure in the shower was very strong (which is unusual for a hotel). I wanted to take that shower home with me! The room was very quiet, and I never heard any noise from the hallway. The pool area is nice, with a gorgeous view of the bay. A large container ship was unloading right outside of the hotel, but is was cool to watch. If I was trying to relax all day, the noise from the ship might have been a little annoying, but that is beyond the control of the hotel. I would have preferred a little more greenery by the pool area, but again, it was in keeping with the cool, modern architecture. We had drinks at the "Odysea" bar off of the lobby, which had a lovely view of the sunset at Happy Hour (discounted beer and well drinks). The service was again friendly and professional. Afterwards, we headed to the Gaslamp district for dinner, which is a short stroll from the hotel. I would be happy to stay at the Hilton Bayfront again.. There were no conventions in town, so we didn't have to contend with large crowds anywhere. This, and the wonderful San Diego weather, contributed to my 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, quiet, close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1313
Reviews.Content: I was here for business and the rooms were a good size and clean. We didn't have a view so that would probably have been nicer but being there for a convention we weren't in the room much anyway. We did the breakfast buffet once and it was pricey (as are most breakfast buffets) but it was very good. Can't beat the location by the convention center & the Gas Lamp area both 5 minutes walk from the room. I would stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: tommym2u
Reviews.Content: We were in room 2215, which is in the middle of the floor facing North, It did have a nice view West to Point Loma and the ball park to the East with nice city view in between. Late night drinks on the deck outside was nice, the appetizers were just OK and next time I will most likely skip them. HATE paying $27 per day parking but that is standard now a days.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: goliathtn
Reviews.Content: New Hotel, location is great and rooms are very nice. This is truly a full service hotel. Spent 5 days at this hotel and didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for downtown-focused or business trip!”
Reviews.Author: meresauter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bayfront for 3 nights for a business conference. The experience was WONDERFUL. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and new, and the location is IDEAL for accessing downtown San Diego (you literally walk over a bridge and you are right in front of Petco Park and right next to the Gaslamp District). The hotel staff was professional and accomodating in every way. The conference included most meals, and I assume the food was provided by the Hilton. Either way, it was AMAZING, as was the catered services for each meal. The conferencetook place at the hotel as well, and everything was beautiful and ran so smoothly. If you are in San Diego on business - heck, if you are looking for a place to host your business conference - I could not recommend the Hilton Bayfront more!! If you are simply on vacation to the city and plan on spending time in downtown, it is a perfect location to access everything you need. A few extras: If you spend anytime at the pool, there will be a guy who comes around and takes drink orders, however if you don't mind hopping up to get your own drinks, head into the Vela Restaurant bar, and the beers are about $2 cheaper than what the guy outside is charging (he works for a different restaurant/bar at the hotel, and for some reason they charge more for the same size drinks) The hotel is right on the bay, and walking up the sidewalk along the bay makes for a gorgeous morning stroll or jog. I walked up to the USS Midway and back a couple of different mornings (about 1.5 miles each way), and it was lovely. There is also a ferry behind the hotel (and 200 yards to the right) that takes you to Coronado Island and back for about $8 total. That is a fun and easy day trip. I wasn't crazy about the hotel shampoo and conditioner (especially the conditioner). If you rely on what the hotel provides, you may need to bring a detangler if you have long hair. Random, I know.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty By The Bay”
Reviews.Author: jogee9
Reviews.Content: This elegant Hilton hotel is situated in a perfect spot on the bay with a great view of the entire waterfront area. Our early check-in was quite effortless & our room on the 18th floor was very well-appointed & extremely comfortable. The expansive breakfast buffet was included with our room & well-worth the extra charge. They certainly do offer everything that you could possibly think of, including an omelet station with a chef to prepare your personalized order. In the evening you may decide to sit around the blazing outdoor fire pit & relax with a glass of wine. The attached self-parking garage is very convenient to the hotel & most of the local sites in the Gaslamp district are easily accessible by foot. I would definitely stay at this location again since the hotel staff is very helpful & attentive to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Views and amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: VPilot
Reviews.Content: This is an amazingly modern hotel ! The rooms start 6th floor onwards so whatever floor you get, I am sure you will have some view and the higher you get the better the view becomes. Being a Hilton Honors member got us rooms on 22nd floor facing the bay, my mother-in-law was awed by the experience, staying here made it a perfect first vacation with her. They don't have an executive / club lounge for Hilton Honors members but they give you breakfast coupons for Starbucks good for ANY drink and ANY food item at their in-house Starbucks. We were also able to use those coupons to get a discounted price (only $10) for the breakfast buffet (more of a brunch.....) ! However the evening HHonors coupons for Odysea lounge were hardly worth anything, the front desk told us those were good for any food appetizer but the lounge folks honored those for only chips and humus serving (weird disconnect). Explained that to the front desk and they comped us some of that expense, Hilton customer service always wins me over ! The hotel has done considerable development around the area and even if you are not staying here, I would recommend visiting the complex and try one of the awesome signature cocktails at their Odysea bar in the evening on the outside terrace seating with a view of the bay. They advertise that the herbs used in their cocktails are from the personal garden of the executive chef, can't get more organic and low carbon foot print than that !! They also have this amazing footbridge that connects the hotel to Gaslamp Quarters, it reminded me of the Helix bridge in Singapore, great piece of engineering. There was a wedding at the hotel when we were there and the bride and groom must have spent almost half an hour just posing on this bridge ! Another tip, if you want to rent a car and drive around don't bother to rent from airport location, the hotel has an on-site car rental booth and with some good planning you can rent only for the day you need the car, return in the evening and avoid steep $27 self parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bgtravellers
Reviews.Content: Great big glass tour next to the convention center and right on the bayfront. Walking distance (with a convenient footbridge from the lobby to Petco Park baseball stadium and the gaslamp district of San Diego. A pleasant stroll up the harbor on a nice day rewards with great views of the marina and boats. Plenty of eating and drinking options at the hotel and great views from the rooms. Lovely outdoor pool as well. We found that even with paying for parking and internet, this was still a cheaper option than many of the alternatives. We would love to come back again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: MagVeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was spacious and I had a wonderful view of the bay. Services were very good. Restaurants on site were very good. The service level at the Vela Restaurant was a little slow when waiting to be seated but the food was very good. The Sweet Dreams Frozen Yogurt was very good and open late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, clean facilities, and convenience”
Reviews.Author: djson1
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel....the things I liked about this place: - Location, within walking distance to the Gaslamp district and Petco field...just a walk over the bridge a few blocks to all the dining places. Also, it's right next door to the SD Convention Center. - Facilities were well maintained and clean. Just walking around the hotel and the boardwalk at night and during the day is very relaxing. There is a Starbucks on site and it's nice to just sit and enjoy the bay views. - Most rooms have a nice view of either the bay or downtown. I didn't get to try their bar, but when I walked by at nights, it really looked cozy. The only complaint I have is that the parking is a bit pricey per day...I forgot how much, but I think it's about $20 or so a day, which is kind of expensive. Other than that, I would go again if I can get a good rate there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the finest business hotels I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel right on the waterfront across the street from the convention center. The hotel is only 2.5 years old and is extremely modern and very comfortable. The views are fantastic, either bay/city or Coronado. The rooms are excellent as well as I said one of the PURE allergy-friendly rooms with a HEPA air filtration system. The hotel lobby has a wonderful airy feel, almost tropical. There are a number of restaurants, a Starbucks and a Sweet Things yogurt parlour (very good). It is also a very short walk to the convention center, Gaslamp district, Petco Park and downtown. I can't comment on the additional costs like parking, internet access, etc. but they seemed fairly typical for a high quality downtown hotel. This would absolutely be my first choice for my next stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Power Outage”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie1056
Reviews.Content: Got a great welcome to San Diego as a guest at the hotel during the recent blackout (9/7/11-9/14/11).The staff did a great job in keeping everyone calm.The generators kept the elevator running and some lights on. The hotel offered a complimnetay dinner buffet,soft drinks,though I was to too freaked out to enjoy it since we were on the 29th floor.The 1/2 hr updates kept us calm but were a little annoying if one was trying to sleep. The staffs calm attitude was a calming experience. Even when the lights came on the next morning the hotel gave all guests complimentary breakfast(which were unable to enjoy ) since we were meeting our daughter at the naval base.All things ran smoothly and the next day they graciosly changed our room to a lower floor. .THANK YOU !! Even if this did not happen I would definitely recommend this hotel. Only downside were peoples pets ,bed not great, paying for parking or the internet. Free WI-FI would be nice and lower than $27 per nite parking fee. Asking too much? Please don't let those things stop you from staying here.......the views are beautiful and location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: ads11
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in september 2011 for 3 nights we were on a 2,5 week holiday in west USA. hotel is within walking distance to Gaslamp with dozens of restaurants great corner room on the 30th floor, fantastic view over the bay perfect hotel with a great swimming pool, gym breakfastbuffet is great and yes it s expensive, but if you want to treat yourself to a good weekend, why not?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sue2000000
Reviews.Content: This is a huge, quality hotel with plenty of facilites and in a great location. We had a good room, not as well appointed as other Hiltons that we've stayed in (e.g. no fridge/mini bar) but we actually wanted for nothing and were very comfortable. This hotel is last in the line of hotels on the bayfront so depending on where you stay in the hotel, you could have an industrial view of many shipping containers, as it's next to a dock area. Despite this, the location is excellent - the Gas Lamp Quarter is just across the road, the bayfront path which you can walk along to Seaport Village is just outside and it is also very close to the Trolley system. This hotel hosts a lot of conferences, so it may seem a bit "businessy" if you are there on vacation. If you have a car with you, they charge almost $30 per night for parking. Whilst we were there, a major power outage occurred in the area. The management of this hotel handled the situation very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MAMCalgary
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here and really liked it a lot. I was attending a conference at the convention center. The check-in process was welcoming and efficient, the room was clean and had a nice work desk and was spacious too. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. One thing I really appreciated was the staff's awareness of security. I came back to my room to find the door open as the maid was still busy cleaning...I walked in and said I just needed to collect something...she told me to please go back to the door and put in my room key...and she watched me do so, waited for the green light to come on and then let me back into my room, AND apologised for the inconvenience! I was so impressed...I thanked her and told her how happy I was she had done this as it never occurred to me that anyone could just come in to the room and say it was theirs. I have had this many a time travelling at different hotels and this was the first time I have experienced this level of security. Kudos to the hotel. The location is great. It is right on the harbour and there is a lovely long promenade to run or walk along. It is a 3minute walk to the Convention Centre and a 5 minute walk to Petco Park and the Gaslamp District. I really liked the yoghurt at the frozen yoghurt store on site too. There were only two things I didn't like: 1) the parking is expensive even if you self park. 2)when you pay for internet in the room, you sign up with your room number BUT it is per device and not per room....so I paid $24 for 24hrs and my husband paid $24 for the same 24hrs as he logged in from his computer and I had logged in from mine....I checked the info and there was nowhere where it specified that it was PER DEVICE....don't get caught!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: Dr Ali M.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront from 14-18 September 2011. I was attending a congress that was held at the hotel itself. The hotel is relatively new, elegant and highly sophisticated. It is situated in a superb waterfront location just 3 miles from San Diego International Airport (Lindbergh Field). Transfer time from the airport was less than 15 minutes. I must admit that the Hilton San Diego Bayfront hotel is an excellent property throughout. The hotel enjoys many unique advantages. It has a waterfront location and is just a few minutes from downtown San Diego. It is next door to the San Diego Convention Center and just a few steps from PETCO Park and the historic Gaslamp Quarter. The guest rooms are very well-appointed with excellent amenities and high quality furnishings. The standard rooms are ideal for solo business travellers. I could not find the room safe initially but it was tucked in one of the drawers. There was no mini-bar or fridge. The hotel has a spa and excellent fitness facilities. I used the fitness centre during every day of visit. The staff members at the fitness centre and spa were very friendly and extremely helpful (special thanks must go to Sarah for her kindness). The outdoor salt-water pool was heated and the water was really clean. There was no underwater music. The restaurants bars are all excellent as well as the Starbuckâ€™s coffee shop with free Wi-Fi. The Odysea restaurant has several iPad stations for checking e-mails. The gift shop sells personal items, snacks and drinks and some clothing and toys. There are also some magazines, sunglasses, suntan lotion and souvenirs on sale. The hotelâ€™s conference facilities are outstanding â€“ perfect for an international congress. I would definitely recommend this hotel overall. Minor complaints: 1. Although I had a â€œPureâ€� room for allergy sufferers, I was not able to sleep very comfortably because of the noise from the pipes and the air conditioning unit (especially between 2 and 4 am). My room (2451) was clean but unfortunately it was also very noisy. I complained to the front desk about this issue but nothing was done about it. 2. The UPS Store at the hotel is responsible for handling all outgoing and incoming parcels and they charge for this service. I took delivery of four parcels and to pay $6 per item. I was not happy about this because I had already paid FEDEX for delivery! The hotelâ€™s website claims: â€œOur UPS Store is committed to providing world-class customer service to hotel customers. We are committed to providing personalized and professional solutions while supporting our core values.â€� To be honest I think that hotel should provide their own business centre rather than using UPS. UPS are more interested in making money than serving Hilton customers. 3. The rate was quite high, perhaps because Hilton wanted to make money from the scientists attending the convention. Surrounding hotels were charging much less.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hilton hotels”
Reviews.Author: smoothcj
Reviews.Content: We always look first for Hilton brand hotels are we are Hilton Diamond members. We spent 4 nights around 9/11 and loved it. The hotel is in a great location, clean, comfortable, priced right, great staff, great bayside views. Our room was a PURE room Bayside on the 12th floor. Loved the views of the bay, Coronado and Point Loma, and the room was very comfortable with no allergy problems. As Hilton honors members we received free wifi and starbucks coupons. Loved the morning coffee from Starbucks and the sandwich or sweet. Had a snack in the Odysea bar since they no longer have an Executive Suite for Hilton Honors members. I can't really rate the food as the only special snacks we received was the Hummus dips (sun dried tomato & pesto), the atmosphere was nice and the service very good. We had breakfast buffet one morning in Vela. I expected more California fare than the carrot juice. The fruit was cantaloupe, watermelon & honey dew melon I can get anywhere. Nothing too special and the cook needs to learn how to cook eggs. Fox Grill was just a bar with bar food and not the best waitresses. The one we had (we did not know) was ending her shift we later found out. Very brusk and uninviting. Will only eat there again if nothing else is available. Did not try the spa. Our son did on a previous visit and enjoyed it thoroughly. He also said the pool was nice with the HUGE television. Had a wonderful day at the Art at the Bay that weekend and it was sponsored my the Hilton San Diego Bayfront. Thank you Hilton it was an added bonus. We had a lovely walk along the bay to and from Seaport Village. Beautiful walk with great sites to see. There were so many great restaurants around the area and so close by. Shopping close by in the Gaslamp and transportation within reach. If you want to venture out and didn't rent a car, they have Enterprise Car rental in the hotel. The only draw back was the parking charge of $27 self park. The Valet was even higher. We needed a car so just didn't think of the extra cost. The only drawback would be the port on the south side, but even that was not noisy and we enjoyed watching them load the ships. We WILL visit this Hilton again as it fulfilled all of our needs. We might have to try one of their suites when all the family decide to come with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great lcoation”
Reviews.Author: enjoylifenow14
Reviews.Content: We spent the Labor day weekend in San Diego to enjoy the Giants and Padres. The hotel is great location within walking distance over a very nice footbridge directly to the park. Great food in the Fox Sports cafe. Easy walking all over downtown Staff at hotel were very helpful and always willing to give you a smile. The rooms were worth the value and the higher rooms have great views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right on the bay!”
Reviews.Author: drdfsdaz
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this downtown/bayside Hilton and had a great time. Rates were well within reason and the location next to the water is perfect for a relaxing stay. Very clean and comfortable, with a friendly staff, as you would expect for a Hilton. Parking is valet or self in a parking garage next to the hotel, with a cost of about $28 per day. WiFi in the rooms at a daily charge or it is free in the Fox restaurant or Starbuck's on the ground level. A nice easy walk along the water to Seaport Village or a bridge from the parking garage to downtown and the Gaslamp District. There is a trolly that leaves from the hotel about every half hour for SD tours, and the Metro light rail is across the street. Enjoyed San Diego and the Bayfront Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ANNMPLS
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for Memorial Day weekend with my freind for a Girls Weekend. We originally chose this hotel based on the pictures and the deal we got. It turned out to be a fantastic time. The hotel was beautiful and the service was great. The concierge was great and showed us the best places to go. It was convienient to the Gaslamp District and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “So Happy We Stayed Here!”
Reviews.Author: SLRainbow
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great location! We booked the "Summer Sun & Fun Pkg." which included parking and $35 to spend inside the hotel. We applied the money to the Hilton's wonderful Vela Restaurant for their fantastic morning brunch. Booking one of their packages is the way to go because parking the car each day can be expensive ($27 per day). Our room on the 20th floor with an incredible view overlooking the bay was perfect and clean and included such comfortable beds with down comforters. Loved it so.o.o.o much! The views overlooking the BAY are WAY MORE BEAUTIFUL than the views looking at the Coronado bridge. You have a choice of which view you want ... take the BAY and not the bay/bridge. Make a PHONE CALL to book the trip because you can request a HIGH FLOOR which will give you a view you will love, plus you can request EARLY ARRIVAL so you don't have to wait until 3:00 p.m. to check in. We found out WHEN WE ARRIVED that we were booked on the 20th floor...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & management team were outstanding during "blackout"”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy310
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Thur., Sept 8th thankfully in the afternoon before the blackout. Beautiful room on the 29th floor with a view of Coronado & the city. We had just come back from a walk around downtown & sat at the bar for a drink when the electricity went out. By 5pm there were approx 150-200 guest in & around the bar area. Management came to help Jim the bartender who did a fantastic job under pressure. Before dark the hotel started handing out glow sticks & flashlights to all the guests. It was amazing to see how prepared the hotel was during a crisis. They had so many company conventions in the hotel as well as in the convention center & yet they pulled it off seamlessly. At 7pm they opened up a banquet room and served all guest a cold meal, drinks, dessert and then even though the electric came back on at 1:30am they served a full breakfast buffet in the morning in the ballroom. Eggs, bacon, ham, sausage,muffins, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, you name it and they had it and all complimentary. Can't imagine how much that cost! The next day the bartender said most of the hotel management had stayed until 4:30am to get ready for the following day to make sure everything was in order. On the weekend they were supporting an ArtWalk downstairs & a Triathelon. Sat evening the Minn. Vikings stayed at the hotel before their game with SD. San Diego Hilton Bayfront employees thanks for another wonderful stay. You sure know how to handle the pressure of a lot of different situations. You all do it prefessionally & with class!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-cool suprise by the bay!”
Reviews.Author: OHLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Book a long holiday weekend stay here and what a pleasant surprise it was! It's an ultra-cool, very modern hotel at the quieter end of the Gaslamp district but very close nonetheless. The lobby is unlike most hotel lobbies and the reception folks are super friendly. The decor is very modern with a nice mix of glass and metal. The lobby bar overlooks the bay front where you can enjoy happy hour while watching the sun set...beautiful! The rooms are very well appointed and we were very fortunate have been upgraded to a room with bay front and city views! Again, the sunsets were spectacular. They had wine tastings, accompanied by 'munchies' two of the three evenings we were there and let me tell you, they didn't skimp on either the wine or food! Fries with truffle oil and parmesan + sparkling wine tasting = ultimate decadence!! It was all done on the outdoor portion of the restaurant Vela - another unexpected treat! The pool and surrounding area were nice though it could be roomier. The DJ playing music over the weekend was a bit annoying as the choice of music was perhaps inappropriate (rap and hard rock) considering there were small children present; this is my only negative critique of this facility. The pool staff were more than accommodating thoughâ€¦as were all the staff we encountered. Given the chance, we would jump at a chance to stay here again! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: BigIrishGod
Reviews.Content: While holding an event at this property I found myself with nothing but good things to say about the accommodations and staff. My room was comfortable and clean. When I let the maintenance folks know that my shower was draining a bit slow one evening they had it fixed before I even returned from dinner that same night. Dinner at the FOX Grill was about not bad. The food was about what one would expect at a sports grill and the service was friendly if a bit slow at times. Catered meals were excellent. Food was not only delivered on time, it was usually early. The staff was very flexible and accommodating and the food was very tasty. Through the course of the event we received exceptional service from house security, catering, and event staff. Special kudos to our main contact Tiffany, member of house security Michael, and catering lead Carla and her whole staff who helped us make our event run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “an OK hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: BostonwalkerBoston
Reviews.Content: it is a decent Hilton hotel, but maily for business people. If you have family, the room is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Allergen-free room is great”
Reviews.Author: RenZhe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the San Diego Convention Centre and within very walkable distance. What impressed me was the impeccable reception service. They served me very efficiently, and most importantly, also in a very friendly manner. The room I had was very fresh and true to what the hotel claimed - it was allergen-free! I did not know how they did it - I did not develop any usual allergic reactions such as runny nose - as I usually had due to my chronic rhinitis. The only downside was my room was facing the Dole container yard. I did not have the luxury of paying an extra USD20 to upgrade to a sea facing room. Anyway, it was great staying there during my conference at the Convention Cetnre.

Reviews.Title: “Love San Diego, Blackout or No Blackout!”
Reviews.Author: JenKlu2
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how well everyone at Hilton Bay Front responded to a very lengthy power outage. My husband and I were staying at the Hilton, while he attended a large conference I was there to enjoy my time. I fell in love with San Diego and the Hilton made me love it even more! With a full hotel, with not only guests, but people attending the many conferences, every team member and Management did an excellent job helping everyone out. Thank you for the free dinner and breakfast! The room over looked the Port of San Diego and Coronado Bridge... if you look up and out the view is great! The room was clean, houskeeping was great, the pool awesome and the food too! Be sure to bring your sneakers, because you'll want to walk the Harbor 'boardwalk' every day! Thanks again for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and big. Location OK.”
Reviews.Author: omnipred
Reviews.Content: Big hotel, nice, and newer rooms. Parking was $27/day for self parking, getting out of the garage takes awhile as many times there's only 1 person manning the booth and there's a line of 7-8 cars waiting to go out... takes about 10 min. just to get out of the garage. From what I understand, the garage is operated by another company and not Hilton. Overall I was happy with the hotel and the service. I booked a package that included buffet breakfast, the buffet breakfast was good, included an omelet bar as well as all the other traditional cold and hot breakfast items. The buffet can get busy at certain times in the morning, so plan accordingly if you don't want to wait 15-20 min. As other reviewers mentioned, the Starbucks in the lobby has a long line in the morning, we skipped it because the line was out the door. Hotel also had many planned events throughout the day, which is a nice touch if you don't feel like venturing out into the city. Location wise, it's OK... close to Gas Lamp, but it's still a 5-10 min. walk. Next time, I will book a hotel that is north of the train tracks where most of the attractions are... unless there's a great deal on this hotel. There's another Hilton where I've stayed before right in Gas Lamp, and it was a bit more convenient than staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Brand-new business hotel by the water, but otherwise uninteresting.”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Hilton Bayfront for one night for a business convention. The Hilton is conveniently located right next to the convention center, and the Petco Park baseball stadium. It's also fairly close to the gaslamp district, though I'm not sure you'd want to walk there, especially at night. On the plus side, the hotel is located right on the water so there are some great water and sunset views. Unfortunately, there's a big container ship harbor right in front as well, so the view was *dominated* by a giant cargo ship. The hotel is also brand new, so the rooms are modern and feels totally clean. The pool and jacuzzi deck also looks like a really nice place to hang out. The decor is modern, with lots of white ... but it just feels quite cold. This hotel ultimately is really just a nice business hotel. It's clean but pricey, relatively convenient but lacks personality. My point of reference is always "would I pay to stay here for leisure". I think there are much more interesting places to stay for leisure in San Diego, but if you have business at the Convention Center, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views!”
Reviews.Author: grlinlv
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel property from what I gathered. We stayed on the 17th floor facing the city and the bay. It was gorgeous! I loved the views, amazing! There is a boardwalk style walk way that you can take from the hotel all the way down to the Seaport Village for food and shopping. There is also a bridge that will take you from the hotel to Petco Park which is the baseball field where the Padres play. The hotel is also right next to the San Diego convention center. This hotel has a great location. It is very light in color, lots of white and blue with light colored wood. It has a clean summer feeling to it. There is a salt water pool that looks out on to the bay. There is a loading and an unloading dock for ships on the left side of the hotel & pool. It didn't really bother me too much. There was a yellow dole pineapple ship unloading for the three days we were there. You will get to see lots of navy ships and some commercial ships come in and out of the bay daily. The area felt very safe and clean. The rooms were very nice. There were three restuarants on site as well as a starbucks and a frozen yogurt shop. The prices were not too terrible. If you can pay the little extra for the view of the city and the bay. It is worth it. There is a ship yard view, I heard it was not so great. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definately come back. There is a charge of $27 a night for parking, which is in the garage attatched to the hotel. Park on the third floor, there is a small walk way that will bring you to the main entrance of the hotel. I did not like having to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...........”
Reviews.Author: kittychantravel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, Beautiful location, Beautiful weather! What more can I say! This place was great, close the the Gas Lamp district. There are tons of places to walk to and many places are just a very short cab ride away. There wasn't a single negative on this entire trip. I'll be back.....

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotal is great. Staff is very friendly and curdious, I opted to upgrade my room from standard to superior, and the room was awsome. Big, very clean, great bathroom. Vela restaurant is excellent, Pool is also excellent. The only small disappointment I had was that the internet wasnt free. You have to pay to have access to the internet. I really think this should be inlcuded in the price, especially when you upgrade rooms. The location is great, great shopping around, lots of activities to do. Next time I'm in San Diego I will definitly stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poolside music too loud”
Reviews.Author: caligirl175
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bay front for 1 night over the Labor Day Weekend. The hotel is beautiful and the location is fabulous. We arrived around noon and self-parking was a breeze. I did not think $27.00 was unreasonable, being that you had access to many different places. Check in was also a breeze and Ashley who checked us in was very helpful and professional. The room was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I was especially looking forward to relaxing by lying by the pool,listening to my ipod and reading my book. The pool is very nice and I loved the temperature in the jacuzzi (not too hot). I noticed when checking in that they would be having a DJ at the pool from 1-4. Sounded like a lot of fun. I love music and dancing but , YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDING ME! The music was so loud I could not even carry on a conversation with my husband sitting right next to me. I realize that you were trying to provide a party atmosphere but when you have many families with small children at the pool that decibel of music is not appropriate even if it's Disney Music being played. Why did it have to be so loud for 3 hours? I finally left with a pounding headache. I couldn't even read my book and when I tried to listen to my ipod I could barely hear it over the music. Would have been a perfect stay sans the pool situation.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with parking, restaurant and cell service in room”
Reviews.Author: KJMgrits
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but they do not own any parking. So if you are driving, you'll have to pay $27 a night.
