I read my reciept and realized that in addition to the $4.00 room charge fee I was automatically charged 20% tip. Glad I caught that or I would have tipped another 20%. Bathroom was ok, no bathtub but large shower. I had to ask for kleenex the second day I was there, and they were swiftly provided. The bed was different. Pillow top, but it seemed to me that the left side of the bed is slanted a bit, as if a very, very large person had slept on that side for a long time. I felt like I was going to roll off the bed! Sleeping on the right side of the bed was fine. Again, it could have just been me. I stayed on the 25th floor and had a corner room. Very nice views, only drawback is the Dole container ship being unloaded and loaded what seems like all night long. I would get to sleep only to be awakened by a container being moved. That is annoying, and had I known in advance about the hotel being so close to the Port of San Diego I would have asked our travel agent to arrange for a different hotel, away from the noise. Or I would have asked at the front desk to stay in a different area of the hotel, away from the container ship. Overall, a very pleasant experience, and I found the cost to be in line with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Money Grab @ It's finest.”
Reviews.Author: TheDuskes
Reviews.Content: Im sitting in this hotel room, fuming...Why you ask....simply because what used to be a decent Hotel Chain has now become a real greedy Hotel Chain. So Im paying 225 or something like that a night....asked for a King 2 months ago...I walk in and say hey...Im Hilton Honors....can I get an upgrade..SURE!!! how about 2 doubles..on the 30th floor with a view of the the Noisy port that opens @ 5am! gee thx... I pop open the laptop....low and behold...The Hilton Chain now offers 2 types of internet...Normal Broadband and a "MUCH FASTER" HIGH SPEED Broadband... So I take a look and see that if I want to use my VPN and connect to my office...I MUST use the high speed @ 20.00 per day!!! WHAT A RIP OFF! even in Vegas it's not that expensive. So I choose the fast speed internet only to find out that the speed is below that of Normal high speed internet....was @ 36MPBS...normal is 54MPBS.. When I wake up this morning. (to the very loud sound of containers being dropped onto the huge ship right under my window...(and im 30 floors up).the internet was down to 32MPBS... The noise was unbearable so i had to go downstairs and work... The hotel is nice and clean...the buffet was decent @ 21.95 and the staff at the cafe were very pleasant... The convention center is a 5 minute walk...and it's nice to walk it along the boardwalk.. the pool is nothing extravagant and I dont know how people can stand the noise from the cargo ships being loaded...but to each their own. When I headed back up to my room....I notice I am no longer connected to the internet...so I had to reconnect...I took the slower internet by mistake...@ 14.00...and what a mistake that was......it could be compared to dial up. I got refunded for the internet...but I needed to vent to the manager for the money grab....I call the guy up...I get the manager of the arrivals dept...who says to me..."well if everyone uses it..then it will be slow"....so why offer it...why try and squeeze people out of hard earned money....why not offer one service normal high speed that is offered in Marriot, Sheraton etc etc.... Sad to see the Hilton is really trying to pick and pull every dime from your wallet... If you stay here...make sure that you understand where you're room is...make sure that if you get an "upgrade" they don't take away your King....or Double Bed...on account of you asking for the upgrade.... The Marriot and Sheraton...are all next to the Convention center...so..you have a choice... One more thing....the gym is Decent...most of the stuff if not all is precor...but get there early on weekdays...it fills up quick and if your into weights...it get's a bit dicey with all the people in one small area....

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: nikityree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Hilton. It was the best sleep I have ever had during a vaction. I am very picky with hotel beds and the Hilton had a great mattress. The staff was nice, the LOCATION was amazing and I even used the spa once during my visit and had a wonderful experience. I would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: JetKate
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at The Hilton Gaslamp Hotel when in San Diego. When we made reservations, the Gaslamp Hilton was booked. We stayed a few blocks away at The Bayfront. We really liked the hotel. The front desk staff and concierge were very good. Our room was fairly small but clean and nice. The bed was comfortable and we all slept well. the bathroom fixtures were a little stained looking so maybe housekeeping cleaned up quickly before we checked in and missed some things. The views Coronado Island and the Pacific Ocean were fantastic. We had a corner room in which we could see down the coast and out into the Pacific. Gorgeous! As Hilton Diamond members, we were given breakfast vouchers at Starbucks. No hassles and the staff there was quite accommodating. The pool was clean and warm and inviting. The poolside service was a little slow and I felt another wait staff would be beneficial. Overall, I liked the hotel and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lelhani
Reviews.Content: This was really a fantastic stay. We travel as a family quite often and this was by far a property that ranks quite well on our list of places to stay. We had 2 double queen rooms; One for our family and one for my mother who was traveling with us. I paid $125.00 per room per night with no discounts in place. I felt the price was quite fair for this area. The place was spotless! The rooms are not oversized by there was plenty of space to move about for two adults sharing a room with a two year old and a 5 year old ( we took a room with 2 queen beds). I know that some folks will not like a room overlooking the bridge or the train tracks, but my 5 year old daughter woke up each morning, and grabbed her milk and dry cereal and would sit on the window sill behind the curtain each morning to marvel at the trains moving in and out ( I only heard 1 small horn around 8 at night during the 2 days we stayed there) and the boats plying the harbor. We took an add on package for each room for a cost of $25.00 each. For my room we took a 2 day wireless internet and self parking package. I was really impressed with the speed! (This is something that tends to bug me in hotels charging a small fortune for access to what amounts to dial up!) No dropped connection problems at all. For my mother's room we took a breakfast buffet and limited spa use package ( she could use the relaxation rooms, steam room, sauna and showers), so she did have to wait for my slow poke kids to get dressed and out the door for breakfast each day. Also provided her some serious recuperation time after chasing them through the San Diego Zoo, which is only 2 miles away from the hotel! As for the rooms, they were perfect. Beds are deliciously comfy, the shower had plenty of hot water and pressure even though were were up on the 28th floor. The toilet flushes whisper quiet. And did I mention the a/c unit?? SO QUIET!! The a/c is built flat into the wall so no bulky unit taking up floor space under your window or dripping stinky water onto the carpet. Always nice for those travelers that may need to set up a baby's crib or pack n play next to their bed. The TV's in the room are 42" flat panel LG tv's. They connect to a very expanded satellite package including CNN, FOX, MSNBC, PBS, HBO HD, FOOD TV, HGTV, NICKELODEON (Sorry no Nick JR, fellow parents) and a ton of others. There is an extensive On Demand (pay per view) service. The one thing that bugged me was that you had to pay $2.99 for each kids programming episode, although for an additional cost you could buy a package. No problem, I just set the kids up in front of our computer for some dvd's or I could have streamed some stuff from Disney or Nick Jr. I know there are reviews out there that give negative notes re: the cost of parking ( $35.00 for valet or $25.00 for self parking) or the fact that there is no fridge or microwave in the rooms ( $25.00 if you want a fridge brought up to your room. Free if it is for a medical need, like storing meds or special foods.) We ALWAYS travel with a large rolling cooler and ice for kid and adult beverages, fruit, ect for the kiddos so never and issue for us. Plus we are traveling by car from Las Vegas, and not by air, so I agree, that is a legitimate gripe. We just chose to work around those things as the overall cleanliness, comfort and central location of the hotel was suitable for our family. We will def. stay at this property again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahandIanHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Unfortunatley on our first night, we were kept awake by a party in the next door room but after we complained, the hotel were very helpful in moving us and upgrading our room. Hotel is based on the bay so it's about a mile to the Village shops but very central for the gas lamp area and the trolley tram which is a great way for getting around the whole area. Very large hotel and although you have to pay for internet in the hotel, if you go down to Starbucks or the sports bar, it's free

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but food's expensive in hotel and staff doesn't go out of their way”
Reviews.Author: FemBusTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and clean but don't find the restaurants anything to write home about. Lots of people at the pool but no service there. You had to go inside to get anything to eat or drink. Restaurants are pricey. Location is great though. Especially if you're going to a Padre's game. Ask for a room looking north with a view. It's well worth it. You can see Petco park and the water. Charged $6 for a UPS package I had delivered to the hotel and had to pick up myself at the business center. That was a bit distrurbing. Fitness center is nice but treadmills could be updated. Plenty of treadmills and elipticals.

Reviews.Title: “One of Best Hotels ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: winksHouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous. Our king-sized bed room was located on the 26th floor with a gorgeous view of the harbor. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was spacious. The decor throughout the hotel...rooms, cocktail lounge, lobby, restaurant was modern, serene and creative. And, the service was outstanding: check-in/out, concierge, cocktail lounge, restaurant. The hotel is conveniently located near the convention center and Petco Park as well as the Gaslamp District. The walk along the harbor is beautiful and takes you all the way to the USS Midway past the Seaport Village shopping area. It was also only a $12 cab ride to Balboa Park which is an awesome place to visit. Great accomodations, great location, great service....what more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Nscc2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on business as a convention was in the same hotel. I was able to enjoy both the hotel and the conference facilities. Both are outstandingly good. This is one of the best hotels Ive stayed in. Modern, clean and with exemplary service throughout. The rooms are roomy and well equipped. Room service and other services are even available on line and are quick and efficient. Food was always of a very high standard and there was a wide range of meals available. The location is very good. Breakfast was excellent. Overall very very impressed with this hotel and I would highly recommend it. It does however come at a price and is not cheap. Internet is $15 for 24 hours. The conference facilities were to a very high standard with a lot of space available. Catering was excellent for large gatherings. Highly recommended if its in your price range. Quality and service doesnt get much better than this in my experience

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in SD”
Reviews.Author: nikkilovesfood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new, so everything is pristine. Right when you walk into the lobby everything is beautiful and clean. The rooms are nicely decorated and tasteful. The view (if you are on the water side) is amazing and its the perfect view of the Coronado bridge! Just a quick jaunt over to the Gaslamp District or the ballpark (although a bit cold for a winter evening, but would be awesome during a warmer month). The swimming pool looked amazing too, right on the bay (again it was winter, so I didn't get to test it out myself, but I would imagine its a wonderful sunbathing location in the summer!)

Reviews.Title: “It's annoying in the extreme to be nickled and dimed when you're spending this kind of money.”
Reviews.Author: none75
Reviews.Content: So there's a fitness club and pool and a hot tub but no place other than your room to shower and change in between unless you want to travel 26 flights back up to your tiny overpriced room, where the two bottles of water cost $4.25 each and are warm because there's no fridge. They do allow you to shower in their "spa," but that costs you $10, on top of the $260 you're spending for the room. At least showering before entering the hot tub and pool aren't required, as there's no place to do it for what they call the "general public," which is how they refer to us who only pay top dollar for their services but who aren't "Gold Club Members." Probably makes for suboptimal hygiene but makes top dollar for Hilton, a company I will forever very happily boycott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views of the bay”
Reviews.Author: mbbeltx
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Hilton. I was traveling with a group of High school girls who were attending a convention. The Hotel is beautiful and convenient to the Convention center. I called the front desk to arrange all our rooms on the same floor. They were very helpful and are rooms were ready early which was nice since we arrived around 1 pm. Best things-- pool is really nice. Our group enjoyed the water flavored with fruit. It is easy to walk to Seaport Village. There is a huge green space between the hotel and convention center that can be used for recreation. Nice path on the Bayfront to walk/run. We took the water taxi to Coronado which was more expensive than ferry but we did because we wanted more flexibility. Water taxi is really close to hotel. I hate paying for internet. So I didn't . But I was in Starbucks a couple times a day for coffee and they have free wifi. Fox Sports Grill next to starbucks also has free wifi. We had dinner there one night and the food and service were great. (My wine was cheaper here than the Hotel bar) Last note. Thanks to Karin at the concierge desk. She was very helpful during our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: mariniac
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayfront is an extremely nice hotel with great views of the city and bay. The service is first class with everyone making sure your stay is comfortable and needs are met. Check in was pleasant as was resteraunt and bar service. The hotel is very clean and rooms are adequate. Great location, across from Petco and short walk to the Gaslamp. The only downside is the Port of San Diego on the south side of the hotel but we had a room on the north side so was our view was perfect! Would highly recommend this Hilton property, as always Hilton is out to satisfy thier customers.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Hilton Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego this past weekend with my family and friends to celebrate my birthday. We booked three rooms together and were traveling with three toddlers in total. This was our first stay at the Hilton Bayfront. Normally, we stay at the Omni next door to Petco Park. I thought it might be fun to try someplace new. I'm so glad we did! The hotel has an amazing location to start. It is the last property located next door to the convention center. Thanks to the bridge that connects it back to Petco Park, you have immediate access to everything. In comparison to the other hotels in San Diego, it is not too pricey for what they are offer. Overnight parking is actually cheaper than a few other hotels in the same vicinity. Since the property is only two years old, the rooms are very nice, clean and comfy. When traveling with little ones, that's important. We enjoyed the Starbucks on the first floor and ate at the hotel bar as well. The pool is great and we spent time there also. From the hotel, you can even make the walk up to Seaport Village. It's relaxing as a walk on Sunday morning. Because of the marina, the children love it as they can see all of the boats. The service we received at the front desk was exceptional. Thank you to James and Robert. Other than that, the service at the rest of the property was good, but not memorable. When I say 'not memorable', I mean I didn't go out of my way to remember their names to say thank you. I think that's pretty much on par with everywhere else. Since the property is larger than that of places like the Omni, you don't necessarily see the same faces over and over again. That's not their fault, so you can't criticize them for that. All in all, I would definitely stay at the Hilton Bayfront again. In fact, I already have reservations to stay there again twice in the next six weeks. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm...”
Reviews.Author: Altitude66
Reviews.Content: For purposes of convenience of its location being adjacent to the convention center, I give it an A rating. It's clean and the towels are plush, but in this day and age, why charge $15 a day for Internet? I don't get it at all. there's no ref in the room. Altogether, stay was fine but I don't think I will be going back. There are other nicer hotels in the area which offer more convenience without extra charges. Parking is even steep!

Reviews.Title: “beware the extras”
Reviews.Author: ajs_EP
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, not cheap and considering the price paid I'd have hoped to get internet access for free in this day and age. But no. $10 a day for a very slow connection and $20 for the faster service. And guess what! That was only for one device. We both had laptops and they wanted us to both pay. Then they offered us a bundle with unlimited wifi and breakfast for $25. My gripe is that they didn't offer this till we made a fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aymee75
Reviews.Content: The service at this Hilton property is horrible....we are here for a convention and finally on the third day had to leave housekeeping a note to ask for more soap. (The one teeny-tiny bar that was here when we had arrived wasn't cutting it.) Also by the third day we had to request more toilet paper as that hadn't been replaced either. The hotel is adjacent to an unattractive industrial area, the view from our room is the hotel pool, Coronado Bridge and hundreds and hundreds of shipping containers. The rooms are also quite small for a more expensive hotel, the bathroom is tiny and the closet practically non-existant. For the convention rate of $269, better service was expected. Better service is expected (and generally experienced) at a lower priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: DebnDen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the street from the gas lamp district and along the bay. Hotel is modern decor new and very clean. We were very happy with our room, while it was not oversized it did meet our needs for. 3 people. Starbucks located down stairs which was nice. Parking is $25 per day. All employees were friendly and helpful. Hotel rooms were quiet. Very large heated salt water pool, with a flat screen tv outdoors the size of which is used for concerts, very nice. Also a large hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and amenities if reward member”
Reviews.Author: sandiUKLondon
Reviews.Content: this hotel was awesome. it was one of the cheapest available for the winter month we were going to be there, i can only assume because its so big that they had extra room space. the place was awesome. we were upgraded to the top floor ocean view rooms because of hilton honors and the views from the room were fantastic (pictures to come). they provide you with free breakfast, free starbucks, and free waters each day. great free hotel gym. amazing pool overlooking the bay. right off the bay path to seaport village. 5 minute walk across the street to the gaslamp district. this hotel had it all, i will tell everyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Bayfront - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: LOCATION- This hotel has a great location. It's right across from Petco Park where the Padres play, the Gaslamp Quarter is walking distance, and if you're interested in the local Trolley Tours (which I also loved)- they've made this hotel one of their stops. Additionally, the popular Seaport Village is easily accessible with a short walk on the promenade that is directly outside of the hotel. Very convenient, keeping you off the busy streets. STAFF- Very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. ROOMS- Very much in keeping w/ the Hilton standards. Good size, exceptionally clean, and some great views. I was able to get a room w/ two double beds for $139/night. That really isn't all that bad considering the high prices you find in San Diego at comparable hotels. Internet was additonal, but that's expected. Overall, a very pleasant stay. Pool area is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference venue”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdandgrizzly
Reviews.Content: Good location and conference facilities excellent. The restaurant and room service were well above average for a business hotel. Rooms were not large but new and very clean. Mine had an excellent view of San Diego Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MaxdogMadison
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, spacious, and very nice. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants - it is San Diego so the weather is always nice for a walk - just across the way is Petco Park and the gaslamp quarter, which is fun to walk around - Gaslamp Pizza is good pizza and at a reasonable price (not easy in this area - 2 slices and a pop for $6). Also within walking distance is the ship museum and the USS Midway. The room was large, and nicely appointed, and clean, with a wonderful view of the bay. 2157 room number. The gym was nice for cardio, they had a lot of floor equipment but I don't know where you would use it. I wish they would give you water bottles in the gym. Overall, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy310
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, modern, clean hotel with great customer service. We had a room on the 24th floor and the view was amazing! We enjoyed having cocktails at Odsea "A Liquid Adventure" as they call it. They have happy hour everyday which most bars only offer M-F. It was cold during our visit but the pool and outdoor seating area for dinner & drinks looked very comfortable and inviting. I was surprised that that didn't have an executive lounge and that parking is so pricey. I look forward to staying at this beautiful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Gerthkh
Reviews.Content: Service at this nice new hotel on the bay was excellent. Location great since it is adjacent to convention center and within walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GREENSPY
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five nights at the very luxurious Hilton on the waterfront. I cant say enough about the service, the quality, the friendliness, and the location of this Hilton. The breakfast was superb, the weather great, and the view was spectacular. Pricey,yes, but it is the Hilton, after all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: scain7
Reviews.Content: in my mind there are always two aspects to writing a review of a hotel. One invloves the hotel itself and the other is the experience at the hotel. A hotel may be very nice but the experience may be poor and vice versa, so I will break my review into two parts: Part I. The hotel- The hotel is located across from PETCO field where the San Diego Padres play and within walking distance to the Gaslamp district. The Gaslamp district is where all of the nice shops and restaurants are located. So, the location of the hotel is quite good if your purpose is to spend time in downtown San Diego/Gaslamp. Our hotel room was clean except for a smudge on the pillow. Not sure what the smudge was but needless to say didn't use that pillow. Our room was on the 21st floor with a view of the city and marina. We had to pay 20 dollars to upgrade to get this view but it was worth it. Anyway, bathroom was clean but not very big, the room itself was not very large but it was comfortable. No noise at all and very quiet. Room had contemporary colors and was adequately decorated. Room had flat screen t.v. Bathroom small but the shower area was larger with tile flooring and glass door. No tub. Part II. The Stay: Service was excellent. Check in Time was only about 10 minutes and conciere was helpful in giving information. Our package included the buffett. The buffett was EXCLLENT and highly reccommend the buffett. Buffett had more offerings than most hotels and the quality of food was great. We got our room for 150 dollars and it was well worth it. Only thing is parking is 24 dollars per day but that is standard for most hotels. They have their own parking garage so self parking was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Resort”
Reviews.Author: glasgowcelticgirl
Reviews.Content: Only had a once night stay here, I wish it had been longer:) Hotel was beautiful in every regard. Outstanding views, spacious lobby, plenty to places to eat or have a drink. Staff were friendly and helpful. I am Hilton Honors Gold, we were upgraded to corner suite and view of Downtown SD and another window with a view of Coronado Bay. Room was very clean and luxurious. Loved everything about this place. Pity about the 25.00 parking fee, but this is normal in this area of SD. The hotel more than maked up for it:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: kharm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Valentine's Day weekend 12-13 and it was perfect! Its right on the bay with an awesome view and walking distance to the Galslamp Quarter with plenty of places to eat and shop! The rail line and trolleys are right in front as well! Now onto the hotel. Check-in was a breeze and we got a room on the 20th floor overlooking the bridge and water. The room was all very new and perfect. Carpet was textured and clean, bed super comfy, TV was a great quality, and bathroom was all marble with Crabtree and Evelyn products. Really folks, it was 5 star all the way. I really loved the onsite Starbucks and Fox Sports grill. There were so many places to sit and watch the water while enjoying a coffee, drink, or meal from ANY of the restaurants and bars. Another thing I loved was there was a small park nearby and a walkway being built for direct access to Petco park. I highly recommend this place for couples, families, and business as it is a stone's throw from the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL UPSCALE, BUT ISOLATED”
Reviews.Author: jeremymelissa
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed here jan 27th-30th on a quick trip. it is a really nice, clean, big upscale hotel. they couldn't have built it any better except putting access to the starbucks and fox sports grill from inside the hotel. the rooms were extremely clean and nice and comfortable. the problem was that this hotel even though located right across the street from petco park and the gaslamp district, you have to walk back down to 5th street to cross the train tracks to get over there. you just feel a bit cut off from downtown. but the views are great. they are building a walk over bridge but it is not yet open. also, there were no place to purchase alcohol to bring up to your room. there are no close by stores or anything. the retail shop does not sell alcohol and the restaurants and bars don't sell alcohol to bring up to your room. it would take about 30 minutes time to walk to your car in the garage, drive somewhere and come back. the other bad thing is they hold a lot of conferences and "balls" there so the lobby and parking garage is always busy. the last night of our stay my wife was sick and we had to get up at 6:00 to catch our flight and they were holding a "ball" there and the people there were up and in the halls all night long yelling and laughing. we first complained at 11:30. it went on until 4:30. we didn't get to sleep more than 30 minutes straight all night long. they kicked over glasses outside our door and when i opened the door and asked them to be quiet they asked me if i wanted to fight. there was nothing done about this that night by the staff to quiet them. why can't they put all the guests of a ball on the same floor? not to mention we were close to the elevators and they dinged all night long too. i did call a few days later to complain and they took my parking charges ($75) off. but that doesn't make it better. when you pay the money to stay in a hotel like this you don't expect these problems. nice clean hotel, weirdly isolated, no help to quiet loud guests, expensive parking. i will definitely stay on the other side of the train tracks next stay in san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the San Diego experience”
Reviews.Author: Joelathan
Reviews.Content: Feels very new inside. Everything to experience in San Diego is close by. Amazing views from every room. Best bayfront hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keepthepace
Reviews.Content: Nice ambiance and great facility. Only issue is poor AT&T reception.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic very new hotel”
Reviews.Author: werdna00
Reviews.Content: great service, nice range of restaurants, great location and easy to walk to most locations - highly recommended but note the extra charges for wifi etc - not cheap :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: yoshapman
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego from NYC to celebrate our 5th Anniversary and my wife's pregnancy (first child - 7 months pregnant), and I have some positives and some negatives: Positives: 1) Nice, new hotel, within 10 minute walk of Gaslamp Quarter 2) Due to us being Hilton Gold, we were upgraded to a nice room overlooking bay and Petco Park. Beautiful view. 3) Due to us being Hilton Gold, we were given a free food and drink item each day from Starbucks. We kept kosher, so Starbucks allowed us to get 2 free drinks each day. Also, because we kept kosher, the hotel had also given us a free food item from a restaurant in the hotel, which they also allowed us to exchange for Stabucks credit. 4) New pool was really nice and modern, and overlooked the bay. Negatives: 1) $25 a day parking. Way too high in my opinion, and no alternative in the area. 2) We reserved a king bed, but when we got there they said they were all sold out due to a convention, and only had 2 Queens. No choice at that time but to accept. Wish they had told me earlier. 3) Walk to Gaslamp quarter has a lot of homeless people, and we did not feel so safe walking it. Maybe once the bridge is finished. Overall is was a nice stay and we would stay there again given the right price. Any questions, please email me at yoshapman@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Anwen
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights for a conference. Paid to upgrade room to 16th floor on opposite side from bridge view so I wouldn't be looking at and listening to the huge Dole container ship being unloaded and loaded - had a view of the Bay and over the roof of the Convention Centre. The hotel still feels new - it's clean and not cruise or convention worn...yet. The bed was very comfortable, somewhat limited tv channels when you're not interested in sports. The bridge over towards the baseball stadium is still not finished so you have to walk alongside the Convention Centre to 5th before you can cross the tracks. As a solo traveller, I didn't really want to be out and walking around after dark as there are a lot of street people hanging around but not as aggressive as the ones in Seattle. I ate in the sports bar twice, first time the food was good, second time so so. You can't access it from the hotel which is very strange, same with the Starbucks. I ate dinner in the Vela and found my food tasteless and expensive - having the discount coupon made it slightly more palatable -- and you can look at the Dole container ship when you're put in a not prime seating area as I was. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. A little too chilly to use the pool and you're staring at and listening to the container ship being loaded/unloaded. Make sure you take all your toiletries with you - I paid $5 for a travel size tube of toothpaste at their Gift Shop. I didn't feel like walking for 15/20 minutes to a drug store. $20/day for the "better" wireless access is downright extortionate - I needed it to access my work VPN. Went to the zoo, took a taxi there and the bus back [$2.25]. Zoo admission is now $40. SuperShuttle was the most efficient I've encountered, $16.00 round trip, they showed up on time, were extremely professional, left a message on my cell to remind me of my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: dsb2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference at the convention center next door. My room was quite nice, with an ottoman to relax on, and a decent-sized bathroom. I heard virtually no noise from outside from my room. Unfortunately, that meant I also slept through a fire alarm going off in the middle of the night, although I did hear the announcement of the all-clear on the speaker in my hotel room. The Fitness Club was nice, also, and unlike some similar hotels, you don't have pay an additional fee just to use it to work out. If you want to pay for wifi in your room, it's expensive, but we had free wifi at my conference and I also was able to use it in the hotel lobby for free. There's also free wifi in the sports bar attached to the hotel. I didn't eat any meals at the hotel's restaurant, but there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel also, and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the Gaslamp Quarter, which is a short distance away. Although my 10th floor room overlooked part of the hotel roof, I still had a magnificent view of the Coronado Bridge and the mountains of Mexico to the south. They are almost done building a walkway from directly in front of the hotel which takes you over the railroad tracks and right to Petco Field. I found the service from the hotel staff to be fine, although they neglected to slide my bill under my door on my final morning there. And unlike at some hotels, where they promise not to give you clean towels if you leave towels hanging on hooks, this hotel actually kept their word and didn't automatically replace my towels every day regardless of whether I wanted them to do so. This is actually the closest and most convenient hotel to the convention center. The Marriott is just on the other side, but due to construction that's a bit of a pain to walk through to get back and forth from the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: toodogsus
Reviews.Content: When I heard we were staying at the Hilton for our upcoming business meeting, my expectations were "Hiltonesque," but boy was I wrong. The location alone is incredible, right on the water with amazing views in every direction, just at the foot of the Gaslamp, and next door to the convention center. The decor says boutique hotel, with cool blues and warm beiges and browns echoing the nautical heritage of the area. My room was spacious and well-planned; the bathroom was huge with a gorgeous walk-in shower. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. We at breakfast, lunch, and dinner there over our four-day stay and each meal was excellent. The meeting spaces are beautiful, many with natural lighting and lovely views. There is a full-service business center with staff. Although I didn't get to try it out, the pool overlooks the bay and has a large plasma screen TV showing underwater scenes. Next time! If you're traveling for business or a convention to San Diego, I highly recommend this hotel. I'll stay there again next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful set-up, so why do they nickle and dime you?”
Reviews.Author: pugpenthouse
Reviews.Content: Very nice location (close to 5th Street), right beside Petco Park - baseball, good rooms, good fitness centre. Was there for a convention ... good meeting/conference rooms. Main peeve was that the wifi was $15-$20/day. The Business Centre was even more expensive! The convention had to set up an 'Internet Cafe' so that attendees did not get dinged, but that was only for day use. Even in this day and age, Hotel 8 has free wifi!!! Everything was set at gouge prices. A Coke can in a machine was $4.50. Parking was $25/self-park; $30/valet per day. Did not expect that from a 'class' organization that caters to business/convention crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location but prices for 'extras' too high”
Reviews.Author: RegularTravellerMatt
Reviews.Content: A nice, modern hotel, right on the Bay and next to the Convention Center and Petco park. This is a lovely building and a morning stroll around the bay is wonderful. Staff were friendly and rooms were fine. However the prices of some extras were rather high. Internet access ($20 per day on some plans), Breakfast Buffet ($24) all seemed on the high side. I must add though that the buffet is available in an inclusive price when booked in advance for about $10 and is extremely extensive. I would rate this hotel higher if the internet were free, the bridge to PETCO park finished, and breakfast buffet available on the day for a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “big convention hotel with friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: trip-together
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here fron Nov 20-24th....hubby on a convention....I went along for the ride so to speak...on a mini vacation:). We arrived late on Saturday as Air Canada has changed our routing...and were left short in LA...as apposed to flying into San Diego as planned (6 months in advance!). So...we had to rent a car and drive from LA to San Diego...the distance was not far...but the traffic was horrendous! It was rainy and cold and we were not happy that we had to foot this bill....Air Canada....grrrrrr.....and....most unfriendly airline there is!!! We had been traveling since 6am that morning from Halifax and arrived at the Hilton at 8:30pm....tired and hungry...as there were no meals offered on board...and we deciced to just drive instead of having dinner before hand...as we just wanted to "be" at our hotel. On arrival.....they did not have our room....the king we asked for...so insisting...as we had booked so far in advance...we were asked to wait... Upon hearing our troubles with Air Canada...the hotel offered a $50.00 coupon for their restaurant....which I thought was very very nice. We ate at their main restaurant. We had a cheese plate....had limited cheese....but the Temecula honey was wonderful, then we had our entres....I had chicken and my husband had salmon. Both meals were sorely lacking in flavour. My chicken was in a broth like sauce...but tasted of nothing??? The service was friendly however, which made up for taste a bit, With tip...our meal with two glasses of wine and 2 pre-dinner cocktails came to over $130.00. We thought this was steep ....especially for what we got. Our rooms were ready by 10pm. We got a beautiful view on the 19th floor overlooking a terminal area and Coronado Island. The rooms are not huge, but sufficient. The bed was very comfortable....but the furnishings were more like a Holiday Inn Express. The bathroom was very clean, as was the room. The convention my husband was on, was located within the hotel. This made for a perfect location for him. The hotel is also one of the pick up/drop off spots for the hop on hop off tour bus. Perfect for me. We did this tour together on Sunday....as hubby's convention did not start for him until Sunday eve.....it was raining again...so being on a sheltered bus was perfect. We did do the zoo...and did get quite wet...but not a big deal ....the zoo is huge...lots of variety....friendly...but I found some of the enclosures very very small, which made me sad.....the panda exibit however was wonderful. I did the hop on hop off twice ....as I discovered the taxi fares were pretty steep here. To get to all the spots I wanted to see again...I could take this tour bus and pay $34.00....or pay a cab each way...which would have amounted in over $70.00 or more in charges. You are quite handy to the start of the gaslamp district...with all of its restaurants and clubs etc. the pedestrian bridge was not completed when we were there, but we found a shortcut to the gaslamp area...about a 5 min. walk to the beginning of it. We ate in this area twice....as we found the restaurants/bars in the hotel were too expensive ....and food lacking.... We did do star-bucks each morning...the line up was out the door....as eveyone had the same idea. Not a cheap venture for coffee either..but way more flavour.. You have to physically exit the hotel to get to it...and to the other restaurant...name escapes me....a sports bar....chain...not connected to the Hilton...but renting space there...good sandwich option, or sit down breakfast option as well..here the Hilton owned restaurants lack in flavour and expense. We ate at Tequila 100 in the gaslamp area one night...it is on 5th...the most amazing chicken mole I have ever had....and I have been to different areas of Mexico 5 times....you have to try it!!! Another night we ate at Bice. Wonderful appetizer...young crowd...too young for us by 9pm....they have a seperate bar area...as you enter the restaurant...very young....the main course was just ok...the service was pretty good....to lacking in the end. Another night we ate at Baci...takes a good 15 min. by cab to get there....so ....pricey ride....but the food, and service were spot on. Wonderful stuff...family owned and they certainly take pride in everything they do. Our rooms here were cleaned each day by 3pm...and the maid staff were all very smiley and friendly. The pool area was quite large...but a bar inside over-looking this area...made you feel like you were in a fish bowel if you swam....it was too chilly while we were there to swim...as temps were only up to 14 celcius in the daytime...and went down to 8 at night some nights....I did find the bar staff here to be a little snooty...but perhaps they were over-whelmed with the convention??? however, this IS the hotels number one draw...many many convention rooms here. One real negative here...is a $15.00 per day charge for internet....this is a HUGE hotle complex...and with convention being it's number one customer...shameful that they charge for internet....especially when on a work related trip and there is no choice in the matter....parking is also steep here. they need to look at the nickle and diming here... All in all...a pleasant stay, with comfy bed, and clean rooms...The furnishings were a bit lacking...but for a convention hotel...hit the mark.....with a few exceptions...noted above

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gene75
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was wonderful! Close to everything downtown San Diego has to offer. Can walk to the baseball stadium, Gaslamp, and the Convention center. The view from my room was amazing...could see the Coronado Bridge and the bay. When I travel back to San Diego next summer I will try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and great location!”
Reviews.Author: dinaHermosa
Reviews.Content: We had a very relaxing stay here. The surrounding area is beautiful, and there is so much to do nearby. Many great restaurants as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel, Fantastic Views. Service and Location Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Ant_and_Kresta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego bayfront for a long weekend in March, after we drove from LA to go to San Diego Zoo and Seaworld (both well worth a visit). The hotel itself was beautiful, lovely, spacious, clean, fresh rooms. We were in a middle-level corner room with a fantastic view of the bay and the Air Force base. The bed was large and very comfortable, with quality bedding. Whilst the location meant that we had beautiful views, it was a fair walk to the Gaslamp Quarter, where all the nice restaurants and bars are. We drove there in the evenings. The service was a little bit lacking, little things like the way you were greeted, and the Valet guys counting how much you tipped them in front of you. we ended up staying for tree nights, pay two get one free, so the hotel cost us around All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed the stay, because of the hotel itself, but I'm sure that would be better places to stay whilst in San Diego if you were to stay longer. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and modern new hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmets
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayfront is 35+ story hotel right on the bay looking at towards Coronado and downtown. Just built 2 years ago, this a nice modern hotel right next to the convention center. The Gaslamp Quarter is only a short walk away and the trolley stops right nearby too. Very spacious rooms with a great view. Nice comfortable beds. A typically good experience for a nice Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but strange interior design”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bayfront for 5 nights during a recent conference next door at convention center. As such, location was premium for walking to conference. Hotel is 10 minutes walk to the Gaslamp District for restaurants and nightlife, and a 15-minute cab ride to Balboa Park. So, it's not the best location for leisure travellers. I got a corner room on a high floor, with great views of the city and mountains in the distance. Room was soundproofed against the aircraft landing noise (airport is 15 minutes away by car in traffic). Bed was good for a sound night's sleep. Bathroom was sub-standard for a Hilton, without handshower and a bit cramped for two. Breakfast was generous; get the On Your Way deal, where two can eat buffet breakfast for about $25. The lobby was spacious, but had a strange design flaw. To enter the hotel, one has to go through a lower-level foyer then up the escalators to main reception. Once there, to get to the rooms, elevators are accessible only from one alcove in the lobby, even though the lobby wraps both ways around the alcove. As such, one has to walk around the lobby enclosure to reach the elevators. These should have been made accessible from both directions in the rectangular lobby. Weird. Other than this, the lounge and bar were very cosy. Mini-iPads were set up in th lounge alcove to allow guests to check e-mail for free. And the UPS shop downstairs offers free printing of airline boarding passes for departing guests. The hotel is right on the edge of the bay for joggers, and looks out onto Coronado Island, so the scenic location is an attraction. Taxis are quickly hailed by the curbside concierge at the entrance. The lobby concierge was very good at making dinner reservations and had a good knowledge of where pharmacies and supermarkets were located (a Ralph's grocery store and CVS pharmacy are about 15 minutes walk from hotel, in Gaslamp District). On checkout, I was stuck in a long line with other guests, but a hotel staff member approached me with a notepad on which I gave him my e-mail address for billing, enabling a quick departure without waiting. Sure enough, 24 hrs later, I received my correct bill (no inaccuracies) by e-mail. Hilton efficiency. Overall, a satisfying stay, and I would definitely stay here again for a business convention.

Reviews.Title: “Expensice hotel on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: GabbieN
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an expensive look, but is built on the cheap and everything is extra. The main drawback is that the internet is not fee, in fact it costs quite a bit. Definitely a nuisance in this day and age. All that is available in the Hilton, I found in smaller hotels, which also usually had free internet and a fridge to keep your drinks cold. The Hilton has many meeting rooms, but that is the only difference. To top it off, when I checked in, the hotel charged the entire cost of the room for both me and my colleague, who was supposed to pay separately and happened to check-in second, to my credit card, even though I made them aware of the situation. This meant that a couple of thousand dollars were charged to my CC, the first day of the stay. I was told they will just authorize the charges, but the next day I was told that they actually charged it. In any case, this has brought my CC to the maximum and I couldn't rent a car, canceling my trip to Joshua Tree Park, which I was really looking froward to. (It takes a number of days for the charges to be reversed, so there was no use doing that). Also, if you book through an agent, you won't get your Hilton Honors points, the usual feel of being nickle and dimed by Hilton. The pool is waist high, with no deep area for swimming. When I first arrived, I came in late at night and was desperately looking for a bag of chips or any kind of a snack, but the vending machines had only pop. If you are coming for the conference, note that this hotel is not attached to the Convention Center, it is some distance at the southern end of it. I was disappointed how far it was, I would have much preferred the Omni, which is right across. Any hotel near the conference center-end of the Gas Lamp District would have been more convenient, or the Marriott (The Hyatt is too far as well). Also, the hotel doesn't have a free airport shuttle, unlike many of the other hotels in the Gas Lamp District. When I checked in I was asked if I would like to pay extra for a view of the city and I didn't, so my view was to the ship yards, with the pleasure of listening to the containers being loaded, irrespective of the time of day or night, but the noise wasn't too bad. That being said, any of the other hotels, especially the Omni, only have a city view, without having to pay extra. I found the room a little dusty, but not sure where that was coming from, the surfaces looked fine, perhaps the carpet. Over all, nothing special, except the price, which was exceptionally high.

Reviews.Title: “Out-sourced reservations, bug bites, TERRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed112010
Reviews.Content: From the moment I began booking a reservation, it was an absolute nightmare. The out-sourced reservation line was impossible to work with and incapable of meeting my business needs. After being forced to demand to speak to the hotel directly, I was promised the same room for my entire stay. To my surprise, I arrived only to be told I would be staying on a sofa sleeper in the "parlor"... the living room of a suite. And to further insult injury, I would be forced to move rooms in the middle of my stay despite the assurance that I would have one room in order to accomodate conference calls. As if this wasn't enough, I left the hotel with 6 bug bites on my arm without ever wearing short sleeves. This was the most disappointing and frustrating hotel experience I have ever had. I would rather stay in a Comfort Suites (where I can have the actual suite and not the sofa sleeper in the living room) before ever staying here again. Do not waste your time or your money.

Reviews.Title: “Slept on a cloud”
Reviews.Author: Shanberry
Reviews.Content: My review will be short because we were only sent here from our actual hotel, the Bristol because they overbooked. All I can say is these were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I hate to be cliche but it was literally like sleeping on a cloud. The lobby was really beautiful and rooms were clean. Since we only stayed one night that's about all I can say about it!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere else in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: zuza11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here to celebrate our 7 year Wedding Anniversary. It was much more than I expected. The manager went above and beyond the call of duty to accomodate my room request. He was able to give us an incredible room with a view while the hotel was sold out and they were hosting 1200 Marines for their annual ball. The Manager also had a beautiful array of chocolates in our room when we arrived as well. Truly much more than my wife and I expected. I think the hotel has a great location if you get a room looking north you get to see the whole bay, the Marina, USS Midway, Cruise Ships, Gaslamp District and some of Petco park. Even though you have to pay for parking it was a breeze getting in and out with the Marine ball going on as well. The view during the day and night were both spectacular. The rooms were very silent, we were on the 27th floor and you could hardly hear the wind let alone you thouhgt there'd be more noise with all that was going on in the hotel. We did not have a chance to use any of the Hotel's facilities, the restaurants and pool looked great and we look forward to trying them out the next time we come here. Very accommodating hotel, everything is brand new and the staff is great from the manager to the houskeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel_495
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew I made the right choice. Beautifully done, very classy lobby. I was greeted quickly and given a room on a high floor, after requesting a quiet floor. The rooms are great. Well appointed and very clean. Some of the HDTV channels did not come in but that's ok. There were plenty of other channels to watch. My room was always made up quickly, bathroom very clean. Didn't feel like I had to lock anything away for fear of it disappearing. Had room service one night. Very good chicken wrap and it was delivered quickly - within 15 minutes. Didn't eat at the restaurants, only drank at the sports bar and hotel lobby bar. Everyone was very friendly. I paid $11 for a martini, which seemed high, but I'm from the midwest. I loved that they had iPads in the bar so I could check my gmail quickly. It's weird that you have to walk outside to Starbucks. Was there for a conf at the convention center so that was an easy walk. It's a little bit of a walk to Gaslamp. Being by myself, I would have liked to be closer. But I never felt scared or threatened, even walking back after 11 one night. Sat at the pool one afternoon. Lovely view and no one bothered me about anything. Walked down the by the water, lovely walkway. All in all, I would stay here again. When I returned home, I told my BF that we would definitely be staying at this hotel. We'd like to come back for a long weekend w/o having work stuff to get in the way. Thanks Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Try the spa!”
Reviews.Author: NT_Notes
Reviews.Content: This is big hotel but you don't feel it when you are on the edge of the bay, in the pool, or in the spa. My hubby is 6'6" and solid -- he loved the massage from Stephan and reported that Stephan reached all of his knots. My massage was also fabulous from a lovely Russian lady. Fantastic. We will stay there again happily. My only complaint is that one cannot access Starbucks from the lobby but must walk around the outside of the hotel to find the Starbucks opening. Silly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sue83
Reviews.Content: The Hilton bayfront in San Diego is an excellent hotel. It is located right beside the convention center (which was great for my husband who was attending a conference), 5 minutes walk to the ferry to Coronado island and close to Gaslamp which offer many good restaurants and shops. The pool is very nice and the fitness facilities are exellent. I am very sensitive to the noise and I did not hear a sound coming from the rooms next door. Overall it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: JSMPhilly
Reviews.Content: Across the street from PETCO park, 5 min walk to SD's Gaslamp, 15min to SAN Airport... perfect location and that's only the start of describing this hotel. Breakfast buffet and the gym are the best I have seen anywhere in the US from Hilton. Staff is very attentive. The pool is incredible and has a huge TV at one end. Rooms are very quiet and seem brand new every time I stay. At least 10 trips there so far.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: dohligee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night because our flight out of San Diego was cancelled and we re-booked for the next day. I got a fabulous last-minute rate on a beautiful, very comfortable room overlooking the Coronado Bridge. Gorgeous view! The staff was very friendly and accomodating & the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The concierge helped us book a harbor dinner cruise and gave us a discount coupon for the hotel sports bar for lunch, so we ended up with a unexpected romantic, relaxing "extra" day of vacation! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Roof!”
Reviews.Author: MissionViejomom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on 10/1, and based on the property, hoped to stay an additional night. However, based on the room we received (with a horrible view overlooking the property's roof) and cold attitudes of the staff we decided to cut our losses and leave after just one night. My suggestion to you is that on days that your hotel is not booked (which it wasn't on the weekend we were there) offer your guests the best possible view rooms so that they will WANT to stay at your hotel again. At least the view would have made up for the obvious coldness of the hotel decor and disinterest of your personnel. We stay in San Diego maybe 10 weekends a year and we will not select this hotel again. With so many OTHER beautiful hotels in the area - why on earth stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Felt "nickel and dimed" in a convention machine”
Reviews.Author: Traveller100Global
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and clean, but I found the experience mediocre: - They try to nickel and dime you: if you want a king bed, they call that a "voluntary upgrade" and you have to pay extra; a view to the bay is extra; bottle of water in the room is way overpriced, self parking is $25 and there is realistically no other option around; internet is extra - If you are not part of a conference you feel out of place (the hotel revolves around conferences) - The location is good if you have a car. If you don't it is inconvenient to get there - The concierge is not interested in helping you out, they just want to answer the question so that you go away Overall I think you are better of at a more personal place

Reviews.Title: “Best surprise of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: BougieKnight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Bayfront at the urging of one of my colleagues. Was not disappointed. Pricey ($269/night). But everything was very high quality. My king standard was ready prior to 3pm check in time (very nice), had a great view of the bay, and everything was practically brand new. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WhichWay2TheBeach
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was better than expected. The staff was friendly and courteous and the accommodations were great. The room provided a view of the bay and Coronado Island. The location convenient and was only a short walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. We loved the modern-contemporary design and newness of the Hotel. We hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: marshall28
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel this year. We stayed here in January and loved it so much we decided to make the trip back down from LA just to stay here again. Its a new hotel, so has all the new features you would expect. I loved the fact it was still close enough to the Gaslamp District to walk but far enough away that you still felt as if you were on a holiday by the sea. The only issue we had the second time around was the fact they had a huge banner attached to the side of the building which consequently blurred our vision of the beautiful ocean views. Oh yeah that and the fact we had to pay to use the gym. Besides that it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Parking Fees not so good!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyPrissana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cleaned, well maintained and just beautiful! We had an amazing view of the bay which was the best part of our stay! Nice outdoor cozy fire place at night and good restaurants and bar in the hotel. The only down side is parking fee for $25 a day!!! Other than that, staff were professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Posh, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: levd1_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with our baby girl, and must say - loved the location. It is a 2-minute walk away from the Convention Center, 5 minutes away from Petco Park, and a 10-minute walk from Gaslamp. It's a perfect hotel for those who are looking to take in a game and party it up at night, since you don't need to deal with cabs or looking for parking at Gaslamp. Felt a little odd coming back to our hotel room at 10pm when people were just ready to go out and party :) The gym is very nice, and breakfast downstairs was delicious. Parking was $25, which I thought was a rip-off, but you don't have much choice, and they know it. We paid extra to have an ocean view, and didn't regret it - it was nice to wake up and see the Bay with all the cruise ships and military ships every morning. We did not try the spa, but it did look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: Koni97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large with an air of sophistication. The check in was very quick and friendly, accomodating an early check in. Very nice. The rooms were clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. The grounds are immaculately kept, with great outdoor balconies overlooking the harbour. The meeting room was large & comfortable. The service during the 3 day meetings was second to none. It is short walking distance to the gaslamp district, everything is right at your fingertips. Definately a good place to stay if you are on an expense account. Of course you are paying for the location. Everthing within the hotel is very expensive and actually, my feeling, slightly out of line for my taste. One would figure that if you shell out that much money for a room, they wouldn't charge $4.95 per bottle of water and $6.00/hr for internet. Even in the business centre, you had to pay for internet. Particularly when the location is right beside the convention centre and there are probably a significant amount of business people staying there. I found the food and drinks expensive as well. It's a short walk to the gaslamp for a break from the prices & a step up in the food. It turned me off, even being on an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: kristenv1483
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bayfront was a beautiful hotel in a very centralized location. Close to public transit, shopping, and resturants. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The hotel accomidations were nice. Pool was very nice right next to the bay. Would have been nice to have some more beachfront location being it is right on the bay. But was still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! I Felt Like I was at a Spa Resort”
Reviews.Author: StinkyHotelsBeware
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel when I learned that the conference I was going to was located in the new part of the SDCC. *** Fist bump to myself! *** While its a little more off of the beaten path (in terms of the Gaslamp Quarter), this hotel is an absolute gem. I felt like I was staying at a W (no offense, Hilton). This hotel has an airy, hip and total lux feeling with great views and great service. Good job Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “New - Modern - Cold - Average - Confrence Friendly”
Reviews.Author: seattlematt1956
Reviews.Content: Very effecient confrnece facility with expense account prices. Upgrad and get a room that does not overlook the roof of a vast confrence facility. Plan on eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Has both style and quality”
Reviews.Author: KevandJan
Reviews.Content: The third hotel my wife and I visited on our recent US trip and we were very impressed. We got a corner room with dual aspect windows so had views of both downtown and the bay. Double shower and brand new amenities all of high quality. Very nicely designed with good natural light throughout. Free ipads in the lobby bar were also a nice touch. You can't beat the location which is great for either strolling along the embarcadero or venturing into the Gaslamp district for dinner. We stayed for three nights and didn't need a car. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “IMPROVED SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: NadChicago
Reviews.Content: This was my second time @ this hotel. last time i was there was in nov. 2009 and i was pleased to see that changes for the better have been implemented. For one, the gym is free of charge now. last time i was there they were charging $15 a day. Also, paper @ your door M-F is free now( was 75C before) . and l was pleased to see when i was there that they had two people @ the concierge desk.. used to be just one person and a long line ! the restaurant is still good, breakfast buffet still pricy but decent. rooms are really nice, great bed!!. they only thing i still can not get used to is that the main entrance to the hotel-- hard to access if you are on foot -- entrance is hidden on the side of the hotel, facing a parking structure . but overall it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacation4ever
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work and leisure (more than half my year is spent in hotels). Also, we are in our early 30's, so we aren't elderly people who need the quiet all the time. I booked this trip as a birthday gift for my husband and was hoping that it would end up a positive trip, but unfortunately, the hotel situation ruined part of the weekend. When we checked in to the hotel things looked great. Directly acorss the street from PetCo and right on the water in Downtown. However, the hotel hallway doors are NOT sound proof and you can hear everything! Literally EVERYTHING. It's awful! We had a room on the 12th floor looking at the bridge. Beautiful view. However, we had early twenty something gang members in the rooms around us (but we couldn't locate the exact rooms to call the front desk) yelling until 4am. We would have said something but they were less than nice and we didn't feel like fearing for our safety. Needless-to-say, we didn't sleep at all and that was tremendously annoying. My recommendation, don't book this hotel when you have a ton of other options around this area. I hear that the other hallway doors are sound proof at this Hilton location, but that was not our experience. I understand that we should have called security, but if you saw these gang members - you wouldn't have said anything either. I am a Hilton Preferred Member and understand what I could have done, but this was just a bad situation and left a bad taste in my mouth for this Hilton location.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern Hilton”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: One of the newer hotels in the Hilton chain, very modern and huge. Rooms were spotless and nicely done, although it's worth paying a little more ($30?) for an ocean view as my first room overlooked an ugly parking lot! Breakfast expensive but very good, woman in the lower ground floor restaurant rude but nice bar upstairs with views over the water. The location is next to the Convention centre and just across the road from the Gaslamp district with the Hilton Gaslamp hotel immediately opposite the convention centre so just as convenient (a colleague stayed there and rooms and lobby good, smaller than Bayfront which might be better?) , worth considering if their prices are cheaper than at the Bayfront, I'd be happy at either.

Reviews.Title: “For La Cumbre Meeting”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel... Great Location, Bay Views... New Look and Modern. Good Service

Reviews.Title: “You'll have GREAT time if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Littletrin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great stay over Labor Day weekend. Went with our twin 5 year old boys. Got a great rate on sandiego.com, buy 2 nights get 3rd night free for $149 a night. Which I thought was a good deal esp at last minute. Did our research so we knew to expect high parking fees. $25 to self park. But the free night made it still seem like a good deal and offset the parking charge. We also knew about the wifi charge. We paid it, but in the future we should just go to a free wifi cafe. We were lazy. The view from our window was EXCELLENT for our boys. 24th floor. They got to see the train/trolley yards, the shipping dock with a load of Dole bananas being put on a huge cargo ship, the bridge and water with sailboats. The boys set their toys up on the window ledge and played and played. Room size was just fine for us, we don't need a huge room to mess up. 2 queen beds. Beds were very comfy and furniture and bathroom seemed new and in good condition. I like that they supplied a BIG blowdryer. Pool was great for our boys since it isnt super deep and they could really swim around. Lots of families so we didnt feel like we were disrupting a "singles scene". The location of the hotel on the bay was SO great for us. The boys could RUN and RUN and RUN down the pier length or in front of the convention center. Then just a short walk to Gaslamp area. We had no trouble getting good reasonable food close by with no waiting. There were many good family choices. Broken Yolk for breakfast. Tin Fish was great casual place for our loud family. At night the Hilton lights this big pit fire outside near the water, and there were comfy couches to sit on. It is probably meant to be a lounge-scene, but no one was there when we walked by so we had a nice end to the night, just watching the flames and enjoying the bayfront breeze and lights. The Hilton also was showing Shrek one night and Avatar the next night on the HUGE screen tv outside by the pool. It was free and they also served free sodas and popcorn. I thought that was a cool idea. Didnt bother using the gym (supposedly there is also a charge for that). The long pier is right outside and perfect for a morning run. Lots of people around and it felt safe. So, if you know what to expect, you can avoid being nickel and dimed. I thought it was a really terrific place and value. Will def go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Gaslamp Hotel, Great Padres Game Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiley12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront with a group of 11 for the Padres/Phllies game. I am just going to move straight into the pros/cons for this hotel: Pros: Location for a Ballgame: It is a great location for attending a Padres game. This will increase once the pedestrian bridge is complete. DÃ©cor/Style: Personally, I loved the look of the place. The outside is very cool, the dÃ©cor and style of the lobby and sitting areas works really well situated on the water. The entrance as you drive up the car ramp to the valet is something that you would expect in other large cities, not San Diego, very cool. Same goes for the in room dÃ©cor, it works. Room Service: Very quick service, good food. Drink Prices: Drinks at both Vela and Odysea were competitive with or less than most places in the Gaslamp. Price: We all got a very good room rate right from the hotel website that was well below what the other hotels in the area were asking. Cons: Noise: The doors in this hotel might be the loudest that I have heard when they are shut. They seem to be super heavy which probably does not help the situation. Tub: The tub would not drain properly so showers were taken with 4 inches of water around the ankles. Check In: We were told our room was not ready yet the other people in our group all got their rooms. Thought that maybe it was b/c we asked for a King Room. When finally got our room after the game it was a double queen room, same as the others in our group. Was not very happy about that. Room Size: The standard two queens room is on the smaller side of rooms that I have stayed at in the gaslamp. Also, no fridge in the room. Location for Dinner: Not sure if I would stay at the Hilton if I was not attending a Padres game or an event at the Convention Center. It is a bit of a walk to get into the heart of the Gaslamp if you do not want to get a taxi. I would stay at the Hilton again if I was going to be attending a Padres game. The Pros do outweigh the Cons of this good hotel in the gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mizmof
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Bayfront for 3 nights while in San Diego for a family wedding. The hotel's location is good and the views from our room on 19th floor were amazing BUT, I have to agree with another reviewer that you do feel like your nickle and dimed for everything. We paid $199/night plus $25 self parking(pretty easy, don't bother w/ valet) but there was NOTHING complimentary. Wi-fi is $14.95 for 24 hours, bottle water in room is $4.50, no fridge. Also the on-line pictures of pool area look real nice because it's empty..wait 'til you go there and see all the blue towels draped over the beach chairs and empty cups littered around pool deck. I was never able to get a lounge chair and found the dirty dishes, empty drink cups, straws and bottles strewn on the trays to save a spot pretty disgusting. The Fox Grill restaurant food was mediocre but the Vela restaurant had a great breakfast buffet for $21.95.....and yes, that is per person. I only utilized the concierge once and found her to be apathetic. ....Overall, a swanky looking hotel that I would recommend based on location only but if you're looking for a good deal, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the bay”
Reviews.Author: DMallyon
Reviews.Content: Large hotel -- excellent location, excellent spa, but pricey if you just want to use the gym. Didn't eat at the restaurants, but the conference catering was well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with average service”
Reviews.Author: tempetravelgal
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again just based on location and price. Got a decent rate for two nights over July 4th weekend. Parking is extra. Facilities are nice and clean. Walking distance to Petco Park which was great for us since we went to a game. Concierge and other staff seemed apathetic...almost annoyed with simple requests such as where to find pizza, or how to get certain places using the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “O.k for business, not pleasure”
Reviews.Author: GOPHER41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 14-18 2010 for a convention. Spartan is the word I would use to describe the interior. Room was o.k., nice view, but others had a view of a Dole tanker unloading for 4 days. Pool area was boring, but fine for reading a book. Close to Gaslamp district, ate at some good restaurants there. Nice walk along the Embarcadero to Seaport Village (about 10 minute walk along the ocean front.) There are no beaches close by, so you have to take a trolley or whatever to Coronado. O.k. hotel for business, not pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Glawen_10
Reviews.Content: Hi, usually Hilton are a good choice when i'm travelling for business. The Hilton Bayfront surprised me for several reasons: - The cost of additional services: you have to pay to get in to the fitness center or to the pool (this is really unusual) - I haven't got room service for two days! And they just said me "ok, sorry!" ... this is not what you expect from a 4 stars ... There are better hotels in the neighbours

Reviews.Title: “prepare to be nickeled-and-dimed”
Reviews.Author: caro97
Reviews.Content: the hilton presents itself as a top hotel, but once you take the bait, it reveals itself to be another one of these petty chain businesses that tries to wring a few more dollars from you at every opportunity. did you choose the hotel because the fitness center sounded good? well, you will have to pay to get inside it, even though you are a guest of the hotel. want to connect to the internet? get your wallet out. it took me a while to learn to avoid these places but i will definitely do my homework going forward!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is trying too hard to be cool”
Reviews.Author: kuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my GF on part of Our California tour on June 2010. Pros: + Good location near the Gaslamp Quarter. + Nice view from the room. + Greak breakfast at the Vela and the view was great too. + Easy self-parking. + After a long discussion get free upgrade, free breakfast and Starbucks drinks. Cons: - Check-in takes forever - Why thereâ€™s only soap at the bathroom? - Pool area tries to be hot spot, but it is not. - Staff donâ€™t appreciate your diamond status. - Bed was quite hard to sleep. Overall nice one night stay. Iâ€™d propably give Hilton a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Bring A Couple Hundred Thousand Yen”
Reviews.Author: smarteconomist
Reviews.Content: New high-rise on water between working port/railyard and marina/Convention Center, with one small end facing the bayfront. Targets conventioneers on expense accounts and Japanese visitors to their economic colony, who reserve the water rooms very early in advance. Modern Japanese decor pleasingly throughout and everything costs only about 2-300% more in USD than expected. Parking $25/35 day! LIMO/Taxi-oriented, but can walk in about 15-20 minutes to trolley stop and fascinating Gaslamp Quarter. No local transportation provided, contrary to webpage. Restaurant offers "absinthe program," which had thought to be illegal and did not try. Hi-class spa and exercise facility. Usual confusing Hilton chain TV designed to snare $ and make it hard to watch free TV. Watch the bay water from many indoor and outdoor chairs, you can see Coronado Island and the bridge , but if not your thing than spend your USD better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton Bayfront. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tchoiniere
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Hilton Bayfront. Got a great rate for it. Really enjoyed the hotel. Room was on the 29th floor overlooking Petco Park and the Coronado Bridge. Lobby is big and spread out. Can be a little confusing to find stuff especially if there are a lot of people milling about.
