However, I found that the staff was always willing to help answer questions. Parking in the garage was easy and quick except on game nights. It was a short walk to the Gaslamp but not a straight shot as you had to go around the trolley tracks. They are building a pedestrian bridge which will be great. I got a great rate through work so was very happy with that. I would definitely stay here again but fear that the prices will jump quickly. My only complaints with the hotel were: 1) they had a massive convention going on and it was tough to get an elevator, waited up to 20 minutes at times. Not much the hotel can do but you should be aware of this. 2) All beers at the hotel bar were $8.00 except during Happy Hour. Little too expensive. Also, sodas from the machines were $3.50. 3) Parking was $25 for self parking (Typical for any downtown hotel). Garage is next door to the hotel. However, it is also used for game traffic and can get very busy before games. Just be aware of that, But service at the hotel was very good and enjoyable. I got free buffet coupons for breakfast every morning which worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views and relaxing decor. This Hilton is awesome”
Reviews.Author: leasesd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for my birthday. The view from our room of the bay was majestic. I just sat looking out the window in awe at such a beautiful city San Diego is. The hotel is within walking distance to the convention center and the San Diego Padres baseball field, Petco Park. I was here however to ride sea doos that are rented at the marina in sea port village. The Hilton is decorated in warm browns and crisp blues. It is classy and comfortable all at the same time. We had dinner at the fox sports grill and watched the Padres down the Dodgers. The Fox grill is fun and there isn't a bad view in the house. On the patio, be sure to pull up a chair outside and relax by the warm glow of the fire rings while you watch the twinkling lights of Coronado Island.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bayfront for SD Comic Con Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TwstdTravlr
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for the SD Comic Con '10 and it was Fantastic! The hotel is what I would describe as simplistic, very modern, lots of open areas throughout the lobby and promenade area. We enjoyed having cocktails in the lounge where you can sit with large groups or by yourself in very comfortable/cushy chairs inside or outside. The Fox Grill Restaurant has delicious food, but the cocktails were not so "alcoholly", had to send mine back to get "strengthened". Bed was great, view was great, walk to Convention Center was short. Starbucks outside the hotel but not a problem to get to. The Staff although a little standoffish were friendly, and when we asked for extra towels boy did we get them! There were celebrities staying at the hotel and a few parties along with some Comic Con Panels other days. Spa was wonderful. Enjoyed this hotel and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like it ......”
Reviews.Author: NotInTheOC
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings over this hotel. Interior and exterior architecture are superb, service was average but prices were outrageous (WiFi was $19/day and water in the vending machines $3.50 a bottle!). The room was very clean with a nice water view, but for what I was paying a night ( north of $300) I felt it was poor value, should have been more like $100 night. Overall I liked this place, but just felt like it was very poor value for the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Air tight concrete”
Reviews.Author: DVP16
Reviews.Content: The good. Nice newer property, staff is friendly, good customer service. The down side is the rooms are a bit small for a new property. The property is concrete and steel with sealed shut windows so although it is on the bay you get to breathe the same stale air inside the hotel. Hallways are already starting to smell musty. At minimum hotels should put windows in that have a vent of some sort for those of us that like a bit of fresh air? Easy parking in the garage that has a walkway to it. Skip the valet parking. Short walk to convention centre (10 minutes) about 15-20 to the gas lamp area where all the restaurants are. But to get to the gas lamp you have to go down the street a bit to a crosswalk and sometimes have to wait for trains to go by. They are building a walkway closer to the hotel but it is not completed. There is a sports bar on the lowest level on the bay front but you have to go outside the hotel to get to it, same with Starbucks, have to go out to get to it. The hotel restaurant was dead most of the time as the prices are the usual Hilton â€œyou have got to be kiddingâ€� prices, wait staff needs some training on customer service and seem to disappear for extended periods. Room service prices are again a bit high but that is what you get when you stay at a Hilton. If you ship anything to or from the hotel for an event be prepared for the usual gouging from them for looking at your package. Suggesting shipping off site. Even the UPS store on the property slaps on a hotel fee.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and good location”
Reviews.Author: DD10_10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and location, close to the gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Bayfront Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple89
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Hiltons this one has to rank among the highest. The views of downtown San Diego or the cornando bridge are great. depending on which room you can even seen the ball park. The Hotel is very big. parking is easy to get in and out. Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The fox sports grill downstairs has some delicous burgers to chow down on. Check in and check out is a breeze. TWO THUMBS for this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Hilton -Everything as expected A++”
Reviews.Author: juls33
Reviews.Content: It did not start out well. They were overbooked the day I tried to check in because of the conference next door. I was apparently perhaps not a major sponsor of the conference and a mere young looking attendee, who knows, but anyways, they made it up by transferring me to a nearby hotel 9 blocks away at the Hotel Indigo for the night compliments on them, which turned out to be an acceptable replacement hotel though really, I would have preferred just staying at one place. I returned the next day to a room on a high floor with premium views, with a letter of apology, parking and internet fees waived and the works. I would say, this was acceptable to me a compromise, and I commend them for their service, they could not have done better. The views could not be beat. But looking from the architecture of the building, there has to be views in all directions no matter which room you are in with no hidden black sheep rooms, unless of course, if you were located in the lower floors. The hotel itself is marvelous, the interiors clean and expectedly hilton-like, but even newer and brighter. The location was unbeatably perfect, right by the water, with direct access to the bay and the embarcadero which allowed me to walk freely for miles and take in the air. It is also a stone's throw away from everything a visitor will need at the Gaslamp District. Although San Diego downtown is not quite my kind of scene, I have to say the recent construction in the area, and the general pleasantness and livability of this downtown core is to be highly commended. Taking advantage of their location by the bay, their pool, gym, various commendable restaurants, all face the bay. Their service was excellent, super prompt room service and extremely professional. Their housekeeping was also good. They also have a spa downstairs, and an attached Starbucks if you really need it. Did not like the spartan and unimaginative design of their reception desks, but the lobby, restaurants, public areas were marvelous enough. Light spills into the spaces at every corner, and the multiple extended public terraces offer multiple opportunities to take in the sights without having to buy into any services (ex. restaurants, bars). Their room service menu was extensive, the food good, though not my style nor particularly creative, but whatever I ordered was well done, presented and of a high quality. Highly commended from me, making it a wonderful week long stay from an otherwise begrudingly businesslike stale experience. Parking was $25 self park, $35 valet, per day. They had multiple levels of internet service, from $6.95 to maybe $10 a day. Full UPS Store on site, all amenities you can think of. A+

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: ilikecows13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in early June 2010. It was not a bad place to stay. Our biggest problem was the costs of staying there, which made the other stuff that was not up to Hilton standards seem even more frustrating. First the bad stuff: We used Hhonors points, so our stay could be free. We were trying to save for other activities--like dining out and going site seeing. We did do a room upgrade and paid 40 dollars for that. As beautiful as the view in the room was, most other hotels we've been to have been willing to upgrade for free when you tell them you are there on a romantic getaway. On top of that, everything necessary was ridiculously expensive. We paid 20 bucks a day for parking and 20 bucks a day for high speed "premium" internet access. We did watch one movie for 15 bucks on pay-per-view one of the nights. Our final bill when we checked out came to 170 bucks, even though we were supposedly getting a "free" stay. The decor of the place was not inviting--it was rather intimidating, actually. The lobby felt like the lobby of a hospital. Almost everyone who was staying there with us seemed younger than us (I'm 28--my husband 39). All the older folks seemed a little put off by all the contemporary design as well. I get the feeling that they will have to renovate soon because the style of the place is very *now*. One thing made my husband and I a little ill was the strong odor of sewage coming from who-knows-where as we walked down the hall to our room every night. I don't know if someone had a serious case of the stomach flu, or if we were located next to some sewage pipe. Regardless, it was definitely more than a little rank and we were always nearly knocked off our feet by it. We never complained to the management, though. One not so significant issue was that the consierge was away from her desk more often than not. But there was plenty to the good side of the whole experience as well. We did have to take a short walk to get to the gaslamp district, but it was well worth it. LOVED it there. Balboa park and all the museums didn't take long to get to by car. We highly recommend Donovan's Steakhouse. As mentioned before, prices aside, the room's view was really spectacular. Coronado bridge and island were beautiful sights at night. Other hotel guests have complained of noise, but this was not a problem for us. We slept through the night with no problems. We were located on the ocean-side of the hotel, though. All in all, we did enjoy our time here, but the time we enjoyed was not as much in the hotel as around SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “Add ons, Add ons . . . really add up”
Reviews.Author: LorraineSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Internet accessis $13.95 or 19.95 per day. Fitness Center is $15 per day. Room service is hit or miss. Skip the spherical pancakes, but the Farmer's soup was amazing. Really disappointed by the lack of details (non working coffee maker, houskeeper failed to change the ice bucket, non-organic fruit in fitness center). Here's a tip to hotel management, if I am willing to spen $15 to workout, then I'm not eating pesticide ridden fruit. Just a thought. Room is gorgeous and spacious. Views of the bay are nice. Location is perfect - close to everything, but quiet. I would stay here again, but I prefer to be charged the right price and have the amenities included in my stay. Less annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful well maintained hotel with nice rooms. The staff is professional, but a bit cool. It has a nice view, but it is at the end of the convention center district and bit of a schlepp walk to the Gaslamp - or anything else. They are building a pedestrian overpass that will connect the hotel to Petco park which stood help with this problem. Also, there is no breakfast for HHonors elites, they give you a coupon for the Starbucks on the ground level. In addition to the Starbucks, there is also a Fox Sports Grill on the property. There are several restaurants that are part of the Hotel, but I ate at a catered dinner in one of the ballrooms and it was so bad, I have never again braved the food prepared by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent venue in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Chingachgook
Reviews.Content: Excellent facility with good location, right next to convention center and gas lamp district. Easy access from the freeway. Not far from Balboa Park. Room excellent. The room amenities were a bit slim but the room and bathroom and bed were first rate. I would definitely return to the facility and would certainly stay there again for a meeting next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got a great location and the quality of this new hotel is impecable. The hotel is sited right on the bayside, and if you get a room on the right side you get great views over both downtown, bay, petco park, and gaslamp quarter. The quality of the room are as mentioned excellent but the room are small compared to the price you pay. The pool area is an excellent place for relaxing and the restaurants connected to the hotel has both great service and great taste. What i found a bit negative is that they charge extra for several cost, like using the internet and breakfast. They offer different internet connection varying from normal speed to high speed connections. I don't understand how a accknowledge hotel as hilton don't offter the normal speed line free of use. Not sure I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: mrsslk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, nicely appointed (although kindof basic), and comfortable. Best of all, it is located on the water and within walking distance to the Gaslamp district. It's also easy to get to Coronado Island from the hotel. We had an awesome view of the waterfront and of the city. We got a really good price through Expedia. Downsides - don't like the charge for the internet and you have to pay for parking (common in a downtown hotel). Our stay was very pleasant, service was excellent, and especially liked having Starbucks right there in the hotel. Also tried the Fox Sports Bar and Grill and found it reasonably priced and very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice for Young Couples”
Reviews.Author: Dpaige17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had free flights to San Diego so we were primarily looking for a reasonably priced hotel since it was such a last-minute trip. We booked the Hilton Bayfront because we found a good deal online and were pleasantly surprised to find that we experienced just as much luxury and ambience (if not more) than other hotels nearby with higher prices. The perks were the hotel's proximity to the trolley, Petco Park, the marina and the Gaslamp District. We rented a convertible at the airport so that we could sightsee at our own pace. It was extremely convenient that we could drop our rental car right off at the Hilton Bayfront's Hertz counter. This was a great way to save on parking since I heard it was pretty expensive. Our favorite part of the room was the beds... we slept so well during our stay! The Hilton Bayfront is a great spot for young couples who want to experience luxury while vacationing, but don't want to spend an arm and a leg doing so.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: dlhackle
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The room was amazing and had a fantastic view. The service was outstanding. The ammenities and location were amazing! If your ever in San Diego, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bbadger_10
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a 4-night stay at this hotel while attending a convention. I was very impressed. The hotel is in walking distance to the convention center, but far enough away from all the hype from the Gaslamp Quarter so I could get a good night's rest. Some of my girlfriends stayed in the Gaslamp Quarter, and they were awaken all night from the noise on 5th Ave. and the train that runs right through there. I've read other reviews about the hotel Starbucks being inconveniently located outside of the hotel. I did not find this to be a problem at all. The Starbucks is right on your way to the convention center. No big deal. The rooms were also very clean. Being a Hilton Honors member I was upgraded to a room with the a beautiful view of the marina. I also received free access to the fitness center and steam room, which they both were very nice. Loved the cucumber water and cucumber slices for your eyes in the steam room. Very refreshing the morning after a night out! I guess if I had to point out a negative, it would be that the service at the front desk seemed slow. Then again, there were a lot of people checking in and out during this convention. It really wasn't a big deal, but if I had to say something, that would be it. Overall, very clean, modern and great hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kperna1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service was excellent and they have a great spa. Good time to relax while at a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “More of the same sterile corporate decor...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to delineate all of these 4-star hotels...the lobbies are just different variations of the same style of decor, the rooms all blend together in my memory, and they all ream you on parking (here it's about $25/night). So, my ratings reflect just those things that pop out. I used Priceline once again...I'm a local and it's the only way I stay in the Gaslamp since I know there is an abundance of rooms in 4-star hotels (as long as Comic Con or a holiday is not happening). I got the two beds per room as I requested, but no adjoining rooms were available. They treated me respectably considering I only paid $95 per room for two rooms....sometimes that's not the case with hotels and their Priceline customers. The reason for the 3-stars is because of specific location and overall feel. Yes, the hotel has great views, but location is a lot more important to me since I don't spend a lot of time in my room...and, when I'm in it, I'm not spending a lot of time gazing out the window. It's just outside of the Gaslamp district, across and a ways up Harbor Drive...a taxi is required to get to all the restaurants and clubs. Unless you're a maniac. When you've got 6 women, that adds to the overall cost. Also, the place just felt deserted...even of staff...and a bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “Dull, clinical, not impressed”
Reviews.Author: mbbucks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. The conference itself was well run and pleasant enough but as a guest in the hotel there are a few things that nigggle me. It's my first time in a Hilton for a couple of years and I was disappointed. The hotel is newish - Hope you like trains and noise from the container port!! It's a beautiful hotel inside and feels airy and spacious but nothing else. It has zero soul or heart and whatever design they were going for seems to have fallen flat going for clinical open space. It feels more like a hospital than a hotel. it doesn''t help that the staff wear something not too dissimilar to hospital nurses uniforms completing the look. The Bar has no atmosphere but adequate service but both the food and dribks menus are pretencious and over fussy although not overly expensive. Service was adequate and functional. I only had breakfast in the restaurant - If you want it in your room it has to be orrdered hours in advance and again is very fussy - God help you if you wan OJ, toast and Coffee. Right through the menus they have over complicated the food to make it sound fabulous and i suspect hoike up the price. But on every occassion it fails to match the grand descriptions. The food on the hot buffet at breakfast is usually cold in my expereince of the 4 days I ate there and the freshy squeezed orange Juice was not. The waiter described it as being freshy squeezed then put in the packet. For a hotel of this quality less than Minute Maid quality Orange Juice is unforgivable - especially in california. Again it looks like all show and no quality. On one night I had the hotel burger from room service and it was pretty awful. Compared to Mariott room service it was a dismal failure. I think it was supposed to be freshly ground beef but I got a greasy sloppy burger covered in fried onions that felt like a bad Wendys. Seriously under done raw in the middle - very offputting for a burger and it sat in me for hours and had an after taste like a bad kebab. Two other points if you are on any floor leave pleanty of time to get around, the lifts work at thier own pace and getting from room to lobby or bar is an expedition in itself. They have six lifts and all I can say is that they struggle off peak but in the morning and early evening they are hammered and you wait and wait and wait on your floor for a lift. They also allow dogs in the rooms and public areas. Onthree occassions I was accosted by dogs in the corridor outside my room or lift. Having some big huge dribbling dog put its paws all over me whilst the owner tells me hes judst being friendly is not what I want in a hotel. And it seems happy to let people stayt with whatever dogs they want and exercie no guidance over thier control. NOT EVERONE LIKES DOGS and I don't want them as part of my hotel expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern, and oh so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: PRexec
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a recent business trip and couldn't have been happier with the accommodations at the Hilton Bayfront. The hotel is brand new and beautifully designed with sleek, modern Euro-type decor-- lots of light wood, chrome, modern artwork, etc. If you're looking for small and cozy this is definitely not the place, but if you're looking for a really hopping yet extremely comfortable hotel with all the amenities in a great part of town, I'd say go for it. Our room was on the 26th floor with an absolutely gorgeous view of the city and harbor. The large, sunny window made the room seem much larger than it was, and at the end of a busy day-- it was a light and airy place to come home to. Very, very quiet and relaxing! Everything you might need is right at your fingertips including a Starbucks on the premises and a terrific business center. The bed was amazingly comfortable and although the windows didn't open, the thermostat could be easily adjusted for perfect sleeping temperatures. There weren't bathrobes in the room, but when I called the front desk and asked for them, housekeeping delivered complimentary robes within 5 minutes. Perhaps one of the nicest features of the hotel was its proximity to the water. Right out your door literally were walking, jogging, biking paths along the waterfront and two lovely seaside parks. Restaurants were a stones' throw away, both along the water and in the bustling Gaslamp area a block away. All in all, I have nothing but praise for this new San Diego hotel and would highly recommend it for business and/or pleasure traveling. It's a light, bright, gorgeously modern place with friendly staff and all the comforts of home. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: ray2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights for a conference. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and clean. I had a nice water view overlooking the convention center. There was a wedding on the grass below on one day. The pool looked pretty nice but I didn't partake. They don't have a breakfast so instead they offer coupons to Starbucks for HHonors members. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the main part of the convention center. It is probably a little further than the Hilton Gaslamp. A friend of mine stayed there and I saw his room - the Bay Front rooms were larger than those of the Gas Lamp. He told me the train was pretty loud at his room. I didn't notice the train at all during my stay. One thing that seemed confusing was where to go for parking. I could see the garage but it wasn't obvious to me how to get in. It didn't matter to me since I was dropped off. Walking to the convention center seemed easiest when walking out from the very bottom floor rather than from the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aimjosh
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is it is by far the best place I have ever stayed at. When I first checked in the front desk agent was very helpful and nice. The room was amazing, and for that the entire hotel was amazing. I will def recommend this place to friends and family. And the location of this hotel is amazing, right next to the gaslamp area for food and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lis80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with friends. We had early flights in the morning and decided to stay here because of its close proximity to the Gaslamp Quarter. The room was cozy - a little smaller than what I expected, but it was clean and served us just fine for our one night stay. We spent most of our last day in San Diego out and about - and the location was perfect - we were just across the street from PetCo Park and all the restaurants and shops in the Gaslamp Quarter. Self-Parking was $22 - kinda steep but you do get in and out privileges, but we found the area very walk-able.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: CBTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights during a conference. Positives: 1. Rooms quiet and relatively comfortable (but on the smallish side) 2. Nice views from some rooms 3. If attending a conference at convention center, it is next door Negatives 1. There is a Starbucks in the building, but is hard to find. You actually have to go outside and around to the side to get to it 2. They charge a fee to use the gym 3. Service is restaurants is sssssllllllloooooowwwww 4. Lighting is somewhat stark in common areas Bottom line: I would not go out of my way to stay there again. On the other hand, it attending a conference and this was the conference hotel, would probably book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Hilton Honors Treatment”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler155
Reviews.Content: I was not at all happy with the Bayfront. The lobby is difficult, too spread out. It is like walking around an airport : ( I am diamond level with Hilton, and I opt for breakfast as my perk. I was given two Starbucks vouchers, one for a drink and one for a food item. To get to Starbucks, I had to go downstairs from the lobby, out the door and around the corner. When I stay at a hotel, I want to be pampered not sent downstairs, outside and around the corner. How cheap can Hilton get?! The staff was less than welcoming. The only thing the staff did with any consistency was stick their hands out for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Blood Stains, Mildew, and Dirty bed sheets!”
Reviews.Author: jonniewalker
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and I cam here for a conferece. When I went in the the shower curtains had blood stains on them(GROSSE) and then the second room had Mildew stains on the tub. Then the third room the bed sheets were dirty. For a 4 star hotel the cleaniness was disgusting. I dont know why anyone would want to stay there. I would not stay there again. I will tell you that....BLOOD STAINS.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive and Terrible Service with Poor Attitude”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was certainly not a good deal but proce was not an issue for this trip. The staff were very rude- The service was bad, includiong the expensive restaraunt in the hotel- Wrong order and long wait for food and actually finding a waiter was a challenge. I liked the view from the room, the room itself was fine- but as you know the service can kill even the best of rooms. Too bad for this overpriced- and rude hotel. Try the Gaslamp( Hilton) accross the street- Better location for nightlife. Probably a nicer staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but they charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: WAhiker
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms to be nice and overall quit. However, everything cost extra which always bothers me. Parking was over $20, internet was expensive, the exercise room cost extra, ... I don't know why large, expensive hotels frequently charge for everything while medium grade hotels provide services for free. I will not stay here because I really don't like adding all the extra expense to a motel stay so I just end up not exercising, not using the internet, etc. Overall the place was clean and quiet however. I would rate it as average accommodation for it's price range assuming they didn't charge additionally for every service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views with a great central location!”
Reviews.Author: captJose82
Reviews.Content: about 1/2 mile from the Gaslamp Quarter and across the street from Petco Park (for baseball fans). Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance and right next door to the convention center. Great fitness center. Pretty good restaurants on premises. Self parking is $21 a night.

Reviews.Title: “They do it right.”
Reviews.Author: patio53
Reviews.Content: I am sorry that previous reviewers did not care for this hotel. I was impressed from the minute we stepped out of the car. Actually, before that as we had to call for directions. They even did that well. The bell staff was courteous and cheerful. They explained all the options for parking, as well as the prices. And, they did it without making us feel inferior for choosing the cheaper option. The reception staff was competent and quick. A large convention was checking in and them seemed to have staffed accordingly. The room was excellent. You couldn't host a party in it, but it had all the amenities. The beds were comfortable with good linens. The bath towels were fluffy and plentiful. You can hear doors close, but the room doesn't shake. You aren't awakened by conversations in other rooms or people walking overhead. You don't hear people talking in the halls or taking showers. Rooms were cleaned in a timely fashion, but you never felt pushed out. Departure was handled with the same efficiency and the bill was accurate. I thought the location was convenient to the convention center, the Gaslight district, Petco Field and the streetcar line. The streetcar line gets you easily around San Diego. An all day pass is $5. From the hotel you can walk/run along the waterfront to connect with Seaport Village and other waterfront hotels. I only ate reception food at the hotel, so I can't comment on the hotel dining optionst, but there a lots of dining options close to the hotel up 5th St. or in Seaport Village. The Starbucks was practically inaccessible, but you could get regular coffee and pastry at a cart in the lobby. I was really impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, sterile hotel trying way too hard to be hip”
Reviews.Author: Steve1
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Only stayed because it was a conference hotel, otherwise I would have left. It's isolated away from the downtown core, and I got tired after visiting downtown each day to have to trek back along the soulless walkway past the behemoth convention center and across to this badly designed hotel that has the charm of an office building. It's cold and sterile and unfriendly to pedestrians...They have a huge ramp for cars to go up to the second-floor lobby, but if you're arriving on foot, you have to look carefully to see where they've hidden the entrance at ground level...an example of terrible design where you start to suspect they've purposely kept you guessing about how to get in.... The interior decor is stark and sterile, and you get the feeling some crazed designer was given way too much money and told to do something "HIP", except it doesn't work here because you feel like you're still in an office building that's trying to be something else. The poor staff are forced to wear ridiculous uniforms that look like something out of Star Trek, and the most annoying thing was the incessant electronic club music that seemed to be playing at horrible volumes 24 hours a day. This is not the music I want to hear at 8 a..m. Walk out the hotel lobby doors to the walkway along the water in the sunny morning, and what do you hear? Oh yes, more club music, coming at you from outdoor speakers around the hotel, because who in their right mind might want to hear birds or the sounds of water when you can hear music blasting at you? Our room was clean and roomy enough, but our window looked out on a panoramic view of the industrial loading docks. We kept the curtains closed. The hotel has also adopted the unfortunate habit of charging guests to use the so-called fitness centre...Something like $25 to go and work out at a tiny facility that you would expect to be provided free at a hotel this size. If you want to go for a swim in the pool, you must wear your bathing suit from the 20th floor down to the lobby and back, because no one thought to put something most hotels call a changing room where the pool is. I called down from my room to ask where you could change at the pool, and the woman at the desk said "funny, you'd think I would know that wouldn't you?" Um, yeah, given that you're an employee here, I would . After she had to put me on hold to check, she then returned to say 'sorry, there isn't anywhere to change, but you could wear your bathrobe down to the pool.' Oh. Thanks. The pool is bizarre at night (giant video screens on the pool deck with flashing movie images, presumably for anyone who finds a few laps in peace and quiet just a little too annoying). I've stayed in small New York hotels where what this place is trying to pull off actually works and is fun. This place felt like a German design experiment gone all wrong. It has all the warmth of a science lab. Loved San Diego, hated this place.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Cold & Concrete”
Reviews.Author: ron_tw
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayside decor reminds me of a high class hospital. Only the food & beverage didn't compare both outstanding quality but at a very high price. If you are going to the San Diego convention center you can consider this hotel for its convenient location....but only in the boss is paying!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Darlenewrice
Reviews.Content: Beautiful scenery and 1st class hotel. Able to see the bay from my room. We had lunch prepared by the hotel on the grounds. The lunch was excellent. The night time entertainment was great too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Bayfront and we love it each time. We will be back for a 4th stay in March. The hotel is new and well taken care of. the staff is friendly and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are standard size but are nicely furnished. If you get a bay view it is spectacular. The only negative is parking is about $21 per day. The pool is saltwater and is always warm.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: andiamoemangiamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is beautifully appointed, very contemporary, and airy. The view from our room was stunning looking over the water to Coronado -- one morning there was even a rainbow. Our room was fairly large and it seemed to be pretty soundproofed. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and stores. The only negative is that if you have a car, you have to pay to park in the hotel garage and it is a bit pricey. There are no other options for parking a car from what we could tell.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, clean and great beds....”
Reviews.Author: aszurh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for one night with my mother who was visiting the area. Great location to walk around the Gas Lamp district and tons of shops/restaurants. The hotel is directly on the water so there is a bit of a breeze but great views of Mission Bay. Plenty of options in the hotel for food, drinks, coffee (Starbucks) and gym. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in early December. We got the stay 2 nights get 1 free and paid for our 4th night. Overall we paid about 100/night for the room. As a Hilton Diamond member we got upgraded to the 19th floor looking the Bay and Downtown. The rooms are new. a bit small, but elegant and plush. The bathroom is standard (nothing too fancy). You can hear the ships, jets (naval base) from the rooms so some mornings are quite loud - however, our family that stayed at the Hyatt had the same problem - so itâ€™s just an issue if you are staying at a hotel by the water. The lobby of the hotel is impressive and very modern. It was all decorated with Christmas ornaments which gave it a nice touch. Normally, as a diamond member one gets free continental breakfast (well usually just breakfast at the executive lounge but they didn't have one) so you got the choice of one drink and item at starbucks or 10 off the breakfast buffet they offer (which is normally 22 per person). I was a bit disappointed with this as I've stayed in Paris and London and gotten beautiful breakfasts complimentary (and drinks and appetizers at happy hour). The vouchers for the starbucks can be used at any time of the day and also you can get 2 drinks (if you donâ€™t get the 1 food item) and vice versa which is kind of nice. We in the end opted for the breakfast buffet and then paid 12 per person. It is a nice buffet overall with lots of selection. We had drinks at their bar in the lobby which was nice - you also get free vouchers for a food item and when we got there it was for chips and salsa. A bit disappointed in this too - if this place had an executive lounge the happy hour would have had more food available complimentary and drinks. The parking is also outrageous (cost more per day than my rental car). Overall the stay was good - i liked that it was a brand new hotel, we had a nice room. I felt nickled and dimed for many things that are normally complimentary for diamond members - so I was a bit peeved at that. But the location was good - a bit of center from downtown but not a far walk at all. I would consider staying here again but would like the see them offer the correct Hilton honour perks that so many other Hiltons do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: laughli7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my husband and infant son. Hotel is beautiful and staff was helpful and friendly. My husband was attending a conference and while he was working during the day my son and went exploring. This hotel has a perfect location! Beautiful views of the water (you can walk right out along the water from the hotel). Across the street from the baseball stadium, and a 5 min walk to the gas lamp district with great restaurants and shopping. We drove to the zoo one day and it was an easy 10 min drive. I defintely recommend this hotel, it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: edubwillson
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the gaslamp district. beautiful decor in the lobby and rooms and plenty to do near by. great views and the bay is right outside your window. I strongly recommmend this hotel to anyone visiting San diego. The light rail is also very close by. THe only drawback is that you have to pay for parking and it may be a little expensive at times. The staff was very professional and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MEMSouthernCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bayfront for the Thanksgiving Day weekend. I was surprised to receive an upgrade to a double queen room (2652). It was a corner northwest room with a spectacular view of the city and the bay! The rain-covered streets and streetlights were breathtakingly holiday inspired. I had dinner at Vela and the atmosphere was fantastic, the fare was just average. The pool and spa are great! V, a female barkeep, was exceptional. Be sure to visit the Odysea Lounge for happy hour (4-6 and 10-12). My second visit was over the Christmas holiday weekend. This time I rec'd a Coronado Bridge/Bay View king room (1002). Although the view was less spectacular than my previous visit, I was still pleased. There was a glass encased shower bath and a convertible sofa in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: attygirl_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel...nice and modern. The pool area is really nice as well. The view from our room (1033) was fabulous- bay and city. I am surprised a previous poster stated that the location is out of the way because it is a FANTASTIC location. Right across the street from the convention center and Petco Park, as well as the Gas Lamp District, which is a very quick walk...and I was pushing a big stroller! We walked all around Gas Lamp, and even walked to Horton Plaza easily. It is also a lovely walk along the water to Seaport Village. Another plus is that the room rates are very inexpensive. On the negative side, I agree with a previous poster that nothing here is complimentary, but perhaps that is because the room rates are really low.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views!”
Reviews.Author: GalViolet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early January. We stayed in an upper floor (8th) bay/city view for a fantastic price. Check out their website for the various deals--we used AAA and opted for an upgrade if available for an extra $15. When we arrived we learned we got the upgrade....a larger corner room which gave us a spectacular view of the Coronado Bridge on one side and the seaport/Gaslight area on the other. The room was clean...the beds were comfortable--even if they were doubles rather than queens--I didn't think they made doubles anymore. We ate in the sports grill restaurant at night....the outside propane fires attracted us!--it was a bit odd to have to go outside downstairs in order to get to it. There was no inside entrance from the hotel. (I don't think they thought out the plan too well when designing it). the food was good, even though the service was slooooowwww.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, will try something different next time”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bayfront SD in the middle of October â€™09. Room Price was the best deal at time of booking through Priceline (2 weeks prior to trip) as it was pay for 2 nights, 3rd night free. Hotel is very new, very modern and urban looking. Doesnâ€™t really tie with the rest of the SD feel though, so you kind of feel like you are going to a different city after being out all day and I can see where some people might be bothered by it, but that was not an issue for us. Room was kind of small for a room with two queen beds and the chaise that was I was led to believe by the pictures on Priceline and the Hiltonâ€™s website was actually like a club chair, but by no means a chaise. I had paid for a standard room and was told upon checking that the rooms will have a partial ocean view. Well looking to the one side was OK as we could see the bay with part of the ocean, but turning to the left we looked at the boat dock and the railroads (not so pretty). Have to admit that we were offered to upgrade right a way at checking at an additional charge ($15-20 I believe). Parking is expensive; I would have liked to have been able to avoid this charge. Internet was expensive as well and we decided to leave without it for the 3 days. I read on some other reviews that there was free internet at the bar in front of the hotel, but we actually did not make it there to check that out. Did not go to the restaurant as well. Went to Starbucks for coffee and bagels for breakfast each of the mornings â€“ that saved us a lot of time of driving around, trying to find something and some money too. To find the Starbucks you would take the escalator to the Ground level on the side of the hotel and walk around or exit the hotel on the side by the pool and go around this way. The pool was awesome as well as the hot tub (which got crowded at times). The water in the pool is heated just enough so you donâ€™t get cold. It was kind of called in Mid-October for (coming from Hot AZ), but my daughter could have stayed in the pool for hours. Would not recommend the pool for swimming, as it is not deep enough. The Bathroom was a nice size and everything worked. The beds were OK â€“ I did have a backache after the 3 nights though. Bedding was not anything special; in fact a couple of he sheets had small halls in them. Staff was courteous, I had to ask the housekeeping for some extra coffee and they left some in the room (loved having the coffee maker in the room and also the safe). The flat screen TV was super nice too. All and all I would stay at the hotel for the special price, may not want to pay the full price and stay someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby39
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for what it is. Very nice new hotel. Restaurant breakfast is a buffet, horrible food. Great views from 12th floor large corner room, however, overlooked dock for Dole Shipyards, and the noise starts at 5:oo AM, so don't try to sleep in. This place is very expensive for the room that you get and suites are so out of price. Hotel is close to gaslamp quarter, and right on the seaport boardwalk, you can walk to seaport village. WE ordered a room with a KING and got a room with a queen and they would not fix. The workout facility is nice, hot tub and pool look inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, snobby attitudes”
Reviews.Author: Conceited1974
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel is asthetically beautiful. Large, grand with cooling colors of blue. Eco friendly and the food is "farm to fork" so everything is superbly fresh. I just didnt like the snobby attitude that is expressed by the staff. There is a fee for wireless internet, so that was a downside. Even the cheapest of motels and fast food restaurants offer this. The rooms do not have blinds, only thin fabric curtains, which may make some feel uncomfortable and others can look down or up into your room. I loved how the sheets and towels are replaced at your discretion. They typically dont change the sheets until every 4 days to save energy, but turn down service is available upon request. Overall, my experience wasnt as fabulous as I expected--lot of delays, misinformation and bad attitude. I just think that it wasnt the type of hotel suited for us. A little too stuffy for a romantic stay that we had planned..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: TheAusCouple
Reviews.Content: Hilton Bayfront is very nice looking hotel but has some major problems, mostly with their staff. We were given a room with two Queen beds on arrival. After we went on a tour we checked our reservation which clearly said King. We advised the front desk of this only to be told this was a request and no King rooms were available. He advised us we could try tomorrow morning but there was no guarantee then either. In any event when we booked the travel, the King room was a more expensive option than "room allocated at check-in" and was also a non-refundable rate. My wife and I returned to our room to collect the reservation and returned to the lobby. This time a different staff member was at the desk and actually knew how to treat a customer. He checked with house keeping and what do you know? They did have a King Room available meaning the original people at check-in had short changed us and the second person had lied to us. The King room is substantially better in more ways than the bed itself. The other negatives are the internet prices ($14 for "standard" and $20 for express broadband). This set a new record in my experience - not even Vegas hotels had the hide to charge that much. Also the lobby is basically on the second floor. To get to ground level you have to use the car park lift. The bridge linking the hotel to Petco Park/Gaslamp seems some way off being completed. It's only a five minute walk to the Trolley stop but there are other hotels better location. And unless you fork out for the bay view, the "bridge view" is actually a truck park with the bridge in the distance. On the plus side, the King room is very nice, especially the bathroom which thankfully has a shower not located over a bath. There is also a nice day bed. The woman at the concierge desk was very helpful in giving advice although she told us to get off at Seaport Village to go to the cruise ship terminal when (as I discovered later) American Plaza is closer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough, but due to some major access issues, it is not nice enough for me to stay here again upon my return. The hotel is somewhat new and it is a lovely hotel. Positive: The elevators are quick. The beds are comfortable. The staff was friendly. Vela serves WONDERFUL food. The rooms were clean. There is a gym on site and a nice pool. Negative: Location, the hotel is all alone on one side of the convention center. While "close" to the convention center, it is still a bit far away. It was raining when I was in San Diego and the hotel ran out of umbrellas and the LONG walk without a covered walkway was not fun. This is the main reason I will not stay at this hotel again, distance to the rest of the city/convention center. Its a good 10 minute walk to the start of the gas lamp district from the hotel elevator. Upon check-in, If you can, ask for a city view. The view of the bay is quite ugly... I was on the 22nd floor and had a view of the rail yard and the bay in the distance. Its not pretty.... ask for a city view. The gym is too small for the size of the hotel. All the cardio machines were occupied when I was trying to work out. One machine was already broken. While there are a few machines and free weights, its a pathetic excuse for a gym in a hotel for its size. If you are going to attend a one day meeting at this hotel, I would recommend staying at this hotel. Do eat at Vela! If you plan on being in San Diego for more than one day, do not stay at this hotel... you will feel trapped away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Bit Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: The Bay Front Hilton is a new hotel, about a year old and a nice addition to the area. Check in went smoothly. The front desk assistant could not have been nicer. The rooms are done is the Hilton Style, Bathroom are nicely set up with the usual Hilton amenities. Large LG TV, etc. My bed was very comfortable. I had a great view of the Bay! The hotel does not have an Executive Floor. You are given a discount on the breakfast of $10.00 to use in their restaurant or in the Starbucks which is located on the premises. The breakfast buffet is nothing special in my opinion, $21.95. and way â€œoverpricedâ€� as are other breakfast items. There is also a Fox Grill on site for dining. I did not eat here.. The hotel has many large meeting rooms. There is a Fitness Center, a Spa. The concierge is located in the center of the lobby near check-in desk. The SD Convention Center is very close to the hotel. It may be connected. The business center is in the UPS Center 3rd level( I think). You can print your boarding pass, but to use the internet is $6.95 for 15 minutes. The hotel I feel was built for the large conventions. Nice grounds around the hotel. Bay Front Park is close/ great area to have a wedding, which is advertised. The location is about a couple or three block from the Historical Gaslight District. Do not get this hotel confused with the Hilton Hotel which is at the entrance to the Historical Gaslight District, The Gaslight District has lots of restaurants, clubs and little shops From the hotel you can walk a couple blocks along the bay front to get to the Ferry for a dinner cruise or cruise to Coronado Island. The Sightseeing Trolley tours stops at 1 Park Blvd very near hotel. Bay Front Hilton is also right near Petco Park. Misc note. The hotel has no complimentary shuttle. Taxi from airport is between $13-$15. You can take the Super Shuttle for $8.00, tell them the Bay Front Hilton has an arrangement to charge guest $8.00 coming to the Hotel. Airport is maybe 10-15 minutes from hotel depending on traffic. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....Again”
Reviews.Author: kvd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July and came back for Thanksgiving. WOW!!! We sayed in a suite on the 29th floor. There are 30 floors so we were way up there. We got a great rate and with the adjoining room our son had his own bed, t.v., bathroom etc. I loved sitting in the window and watching the boats in the bay and all the activity in the Gaslamp District. My husband and son enjoyed swimming in the salt water pool and sitting in the spa. Everyone was very kind and helpful. I've read negative reviews about the staff but we didn't have one problem. Usually if you're nice to people, they will be nice to you. I'm looking forward to a return trip. We parked in the parking garage and left our car there the whole time. We walked everywhere and one day took the trolley all the way down to the outlet mall in San Yisidro. That was an adventure! The Concierge was very helpful with giving directions and answering all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Loved the pool area. We had our own cabana (no fee) and it overlooks the Bayfront. Our room was new and very clean. Excellent housekeeping. Very comfy bed. Our kids loved watching the Dole banana boat unload in the Bay from our room view. Close enough to the Convention center and Gaslamp District to walk. No airport shuttle but close enough that a taxi ride isn't too expensive. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. The location is very good both for being near the convention center and an easy walk to the Gaslamp District. Since it is right on San Diego Bay, the outdoor restaurants and pool have a nice sunny and airy feel, and you can walk along the waterfront promenade to other hotels along the water. The public rooms are very nice with cocktail lounges everywhere and outdoor drinks possible on the terrace. The staff was very nice throughout -- check-in, waistaff, housekeeping, pool and spa people, etc. Room 1510 had two queen beds and was the typical well-fitted-out business class hotel room - everything you expect, but nothing surprising (i.e. coffee maker, iron an dironing board, very good internet connections, etc.) Nice size room and bathroom, and every felt fresh (the hotel is not that old.) Nice toiletries. Spotless housekeeping. The room looks south over the Coronado Bridge and Bay -- some may prefer a view north that includes the bay and more of a city view. You immediately overlook the pool, which is nice, and a shpiping transit area further beyond. This is less lovely, but it was actually interesting to watch the Dole banana container ship loading (but that's me.) There is a very nice outdoor pool area with towels, food an beverage options, etc. It is attached to a fitness center with good equipment and a nice view of the Bay. There is a small spa and locker area with an assortment of services. My sister was with me on this trip, and she enjoyed a few of the services -- I was busy. She thought the staff was friendly and professional. The spa has a free sauna of aromatic woods -- really nice if you like heat. The food at the restaurant at breakfast and lunch was very good and on the pricey side as one expects at a place like this. There is a lunch buffet for approx. $22. Bothersome: you can order a la carte items like a bagel and coffee, but this option is not shown on the menu -- only major plates of breakfast are on the a la carte menu. If you ask, the staff is very pleasant about filling requests -- but why should I have to guess about these items? There is also a sports bar and Starbucks that are entered from the outside of the hotel -- possibly to attract convention goers from across the street. The sports bar is quite nice and can put together some good main-dish salads. There is a separate dining section from the bar itself, and the outdoor seating is very pleasant, inclduing the fire pit. The Starbucks is a Starbucks, but I have a complaint: the music is head-banging irritating, especially in the morning. Given the typical customers, this music wasobviously the preference of the staff, not the guests. Most customers tried to be outside, even in damp weather. My only other complaints are somewhat minor: the hotel again tries to nickle-and-dime you for extra charges for the internet, the fitness center (pool is free, I think.) I got the fitness center free given my booking rate, but not the internet. My convention rate was more expensive, and at first did not cover the internet rate, but then we complained and it did, but even then the rate I found online was better, even when I paid extra for the internet. The point: look for online rates, and call the hotel to negotiate. It shouldn't be this complicated or this annoying. Because it is near the Convention Center, the hotel allows the pool area can be booked for special events. This happened only once during a 5-night stay, but the staff shooed people away by 4 for an evening cocktail and dinner event. Fair warning if you counted on the pool for an after-work or after-dinner swim. But these days, it happens, and I have to compliment the banquet people on a good job for some of my industry events held at the hotel. The fitness facilities were very nice, but some of the spa services compete with guests who are trying to clean up inthe locker room. One day, a staff member was doing the hair of a client in the same smallish area were guests were trying to put themselves together. There were too few outlets for various hair dryers and styling appliances. It would be nice if more tourist brochures were immediately available. While the concierges are very accomplished, you had to ask for everything, which could result in a back up if all you wanted was an area map. One complaint more: for a hotel this new, some of our presentations in the conference rooms had a few technical glitches. This shouldn't happen at a new hotel, and some of the rooms could have been outfitted better for presentations. Still, it was a very nice stay and I'd consider it again. However, there are other hotels along the bay, and I'd at least do a quick search.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: Galactus23
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for meeting at convention center. Started at another hotel, but moved to Hilton after few days b/c got a great rate. The Hotel was great for location, restaurants, comfort. Proximity to convention center can't be beat. Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lebh2o
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of the terrible customer service, I was expecting a bad experience. I was pleasantly surprised. After flying several hours from the East Coast, our flight landed at 11:00 a.m. and we rented a car and drove to the Hilton Bayfront. Upon arrival at 11:30 A.M. we didn't expect our room to be ready, but wanted to check anyway and get a recommendation for lunch while we were there. Wearing comfy sweats, t-shirt and tennis shoes due to the long flight, I didn't look my best as I got out of the car and entered the hotel. That didn't matter to the valet/bellman, as he was very pleasant and opened the car door for me. We didn't need our bags carried in at that point, and he told us that he would be upset if we didn't let him know how he could make our stay most excellent. Wow, what a first impression. Bonus material: My room was ready too (Sunday). Everyone we encountered from the front desk, to the concierge, maids, and service workers proving food at the conference I attended, were so exceptionally nice it blew my mind. Every worker at all resturaunts and stores had this same pleasant attitude. I'm from the deep South, and we're supposed to be known for friendliness. I was absolutely astonished that San Diego had such a great attitude in general. We don't have anything on these people! The hotel was very clean and modern. My room number was 718 and faced the Dole "Banana Boat" that comes in on Mondays and Tuesdays. It was a little noisy, but not bad. It unloads 491 cargo containers, so they work pretty much around the clock to get it back out to sea in two days. Room also faced Coronado Bridge. Be prepared: Parking is $20 per day. When you leave the parking garage, you must turn right and drive 1000 feet before you can make a U-turn. They also deliver a paper every morning. If you don't want it, let them know and they take 75 cents off your bill daily. GPS won't work either, I suspect because its such a new property. I plugged in 100 Park Blvd. and it got me close enough. Walking to the GasLamp was about a 5-10 minute walk, and was pretty desolate from the Hilton Bayfront. I would definitely not walk by myself, but felt fairly safe with one other female. This hotel is the last one on a row of hotels before you get to the shipyard. Beds were comfortable. Good water pressure for the shower. Hot water is REALLY hot, so watch this if you have a child in your room. There's always lots of cool stuff to see from the pool area and front of the hotel. Military ships cascade by, low flying helecoptors, F-18's on practice runs, dophins jumping in boats for Military training, etc. Sunsets were gorgeous too. Overall, a great experience. I definitely want to come back someday with my family for a vacation, and wouldn't hesitate to pick Hilton Bayfront again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Xman_7
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel. My room on the 14th floor was nicely furnished and quiet, with a nice view of the city and bay. Minor gripes: it took hot water a long time to reach the sink (but not the shower). In some of the public areas they play what they think is "hip" music, sometimes louder than they should, and it can sometimes be mind-numbingly repetitive. The location is convenient to the convention center and gaslamp district. But walking distances are longer than they look (due to the gigantic scale of the buildings in this area) and the convention center area (which you must traverse to get to the gaslamp district) is quite deserted and desolate at night. The back of the hotel faces a container port and rail yard. I didn't face that way, so I can't comment if there is any noise etc. I tried the buffet breakfast and it was good, but if you pay the full price of $22 it's quite expensive. The main issue is value for money: high room rates plus $14/day internet. And wireless coverage did not extend to some of the hotel's own meeting rooms (the same ones which were also 3G deadspots except for Verizon).

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: frankhurtte
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new Hilton Property. I understand it was opened early this spring. The hotel is great, the facilities are everything you would expect from an upscale convention hotel. It is located directly accross the street from the San Diego Convention Center. The Gaslight section of San Diego is a long 3 blocks away. This locataion has hundreds of restaurants, bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great city/ Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oreowing1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was very luxurious. The Room service menu was unreal. First page had listed 1 Egg, $7. We decided to go to Dennys

Reviews.Title: “Pay more to...pay even more!”
Reviews.Author: Eynaim
Reviews.Content: I had a great room on the 30th floor with a great view of the bay. The room was nice. What bothered me about the hotel was the lack of value for money. On top of the already expensive room rates, there was a charge for everything! Internet, the gym, parking...it seemed a little excessive. Even the Starbucks in the hotel was overpriced! I also found the staff unaccommodating. I was here for a conference and asked if I could check in early. They said they would rush my room so that it would be ready early and call me. They never called - I checked back multiple times and was finally able to check in....at 5:30pm. All in all, I was very disappointed and dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JulieH6
Reviews.Content: We received a corner suite with a living area, wet bar, two bathrooms, and a magnificant panaramic view of the water and city. Big space for our 3 year old to run around and play with his trucks after being out all day. Great staff and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but internet access far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: DC_Karla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and in a great location if you have activities at the Convention Center. However, internet access is $20.00 per night! This is really outrageous. Also, they have a very limited gym and charge $15.00 per day per person (not per room) for access to the gym. And, of course, hotel meals and drinks are exorbitantly expensive. So, if staying here, do not use any of the hotel services. Parking is $21. per night

Reviews.Title: “Classy Upscale New San Diego Hotel Brings Rave Reviews”
Reviews.Author: babsmalone
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is ave size, but nicely appointed, clean and modern. The staff was glad to upgrade us to a high floor where we were able to enjoy nightly fireworks on the bay. The sports bar downstairs has wondeful fire-lit ambiance and excellent food. Starbucks is on the premesis but must be accessed from outside. Parking cost was the only drawback ($21 nightly). Unless otherwise mentioned the cost will be added to the bill. The hotel is in close proximity to all downtown restaurants and Padre games. We look forward to another visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great views and location”
Reviews.Author: genwithag215
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 4th of July. Great location for the Big Bay Boom (fireworks show) and very short walk to the Padres game, Convention Center, and the Gaslamp District. Rooms were VERY pricey, so use Hilton Honors points if you can. Rooms are very nice and ours had a great view. A little hard to find using my TomTom as it was confused by the railroad tracks that we could not cross. Overall, great experience!

Reviews.Title: “I love This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cytrinelowell
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the San DIego Bayfront Hilton on a sunday night and it is one of the most wonderful hotels i have been to in the downtown area. I love the location (near the bustle, but far enough away for less noise and traffic.) They have the choice for self parking (even though it was a walk), it was affordable. Also it was a walk, but my husband and I walked everywhere so it didn't mean anything to us. The room was very stylish and the lobby was awesome. I love the paperless part of the hotel (better for the environment and I don't have to worry about stubborn papers getting lost). Even though we booked the most standard of rooms, the port view had the most awesome view of coronado and the port.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TXGIRL092007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a long weekend in San Diego. The hotel was very nice and in the perfect location. It was a 15 minute cab ride from the airport and within walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter, Pecto Park, and the pier. The hotel is on the bay and we had a beautiful view of the mountains and the water. We did not rent a car and it's really not necessary if you plan to stay in the general area. Plus, parking at the hotel is expensive. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants because they seemed overpriced and we preferred to venture out. The Gaslamp Quarter has every restaurant and bar you could ever hope for - great fish and chips at Tin Fish, excellent seafood at Lou and Mickey's if you want a nicer restaurant, good breakfast at The Broken Yolk and really good breakfast (especially pancakes) at Richard Walker's. Richard Walker's gets very busy on the weekends, we waited in line for almost 45 minutes on Sunday morning, but it was worth it. The Zoo is a 20 minute cab ride from the hotel. It's very big and has lots of animals, but very expensive. It was $70 for the two of us. The highlight of our trip was taking the water taxi (it leaves the pier every 2 hours) to Coronado Island. It is absolute paradise over there. The main part of the island is 2 miles from where the boat drops you off, so you can walk, take a trolley, or rent bicycles. We rented bikes and it was such a beautiful, relaxing way to see the island. There's a bike route that runs along the water and the golf course and it ends near the Hotel Del Coronado, which is amazing. The pacific ocean is at the back of the hotel and it is stunning. Lots of restaurants and shopping on the island as well. Overall, we loved our trip to San Diego. Everything is expensive, but it's California so you have to expect that.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel with Big Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days while attending a businss conference. While the hotel is new and clean its interior and common areas are very modern and sterile. Too sterile. The rooms are nice, however, sterile as well. The second bed in the room had not been changed, I found debris in the sheets, the comfortor had make-up stains. The shower head could be found in any Motel 6. I parked a car in the garage ($21 per day) and prepaid for 2 days. I turned the car into the Hertz desk after the first day and was refunded one day parking on my bill. Every day after that I was charged $42 which was refunded (an automatic computer entry I was told). The restaurant and bar were very expensive, I didn't ever venture into either. The Fox Sports Bar was the chosen spot. There is not an entrance to the Fox Sports Bar from the hotel, one must go outside to enter (explained that Fox rents space from Hilton). Staff there were young, most were helpful but inexperienced in treating people friendly. The conciere at the hotel was the most curt unprofessional person I have ever encoutered at a conciere desk. She was efficient, however. Hilton needs to find a polite and friendly person to put at that desk and that would not be the blonde, thin, female that was working when I was there. The front desk people are usually working on a computer when you approach and are seemingly too busy to help those waiting. No check out process except to approach this desk. The conference wait staff is the exception, they are very polite, greet you in hallways, and are very helpful. To end this review, Hilton, you need to take a look at this hotel, send most everyone to a customer service school, work out the union issues, and buy a bouquets of flowers for the common areas to soften the blow of modernism and sterility. Get to work Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: newb85
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the nicest hotels I've ever set foot in! Very new, very impressive! The beds were comfortable, the room was comfortable (although a little tight for four women who don't pack light!), everything was great! I don't know how long this hotel has been open, but the rate we had for one night (on a Saturday!) was pretty fantastic. Therefore, there was a bachelorette party in the room across from us, and two rooms full of boys celebrating someone's birthday about 10 rooms down from us. We didn't hear anything from the bachelorette group (they had only decorated the door with ribbon and that's how we knew) but the boys decided to throw out one of the guys for a little streaking. Even though it was 11PM, probably still a bad idea! I would definitely stay here again and I definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Winner on the Port”
Reviews.Author: TONEYTUNES
Reviews.Content: This new and modern hotel is by far a pleasant surprise. The rate was very reasonable and the service was impeccible. Everything in the room worked. There were no glitches, and the internet (for a fee) works perfectly. It's only a short walk away to Petco Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but expected more”
Reviews.Author: TinaAndStu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent, and rates were fairly priced, but our overall impression was that the accomodations were average and the hotel wasn't quite as aethetically pleasing as we expected it would be. The exterior of the bulding looked very industrial. And while lounging at the pool, you can watch the cranes unload trailers at the shipyard. The interior was bright and modern. The staff at check in and the valets were friendly and very customer service oriented. Rooms were nice, would be better for a business trip than a night on the town, which is why we were there. Our view of the Coronado bridge was unpleasantly complimented by the docks. Upon arrival, we watched the banana boat unload. There is no mini-bar and no robes, but the bed was very comforable. With the exception of one spaced out server, the folks at Fox Sports Grill were a lot of fun and took great care of us. The staff at Odysea bar were just boring. I would recommend this place for a business traveler. For us, there are many sexier places to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: moodyblue
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I only was able to spend about 18 hours in the Hilton Bayfront - but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay for the short time I was there. I found the room to be quite stylish and well furnished. I'm pretty sensitive to hard/soft beds, but this one was really excellent, as were the pillows. The only comment I could make about the room - and this is really nitpicking - is that the shower nozzle was standard issue. Given the quality of the hotel, I really expected something more along the lines of a rainfall showerhead; but again this is a very minor point. I ate dinner in Vela and had a great dinner (king salmon). The tasting board appetizer - though expensive - was excellent and very substantial - for many, that would be a meal. I also had the breakfast buffet and while I wouldn't take my family there at $25/head, I felt the quality was very good with an extensive selection of breakfast items. The only real issue I have with the hotel is their checkout policy. I'm not sure why they do it this way, but this is one of the few hotels I've stayed at where you don't receive the bill under the door. As a result, you have to actually go to the front desk and checkout. Given the size of the hotel, this could be a problem - as was the case when I stayed there. Quite a few people were trying to check out at the same time and with a flight to catch, I wasn't planning on burning 15 minutes standing in line waiting to turn in my room key.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but consider options”
Reviews.Author: twins1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night and although this is a clean new property, I would consider elsewhere if you are having to pay the rack rate. Hotel is very nice, in a convenient area and offers beautiful views of the city and waterfront. I lucked out when the rate dropped so I re-booked a high floor water/city view for just over $100 a night with visa discount. Parking is $21.00 for self park so consider that into rate as well. The rooms were a bit small but appointed very well and had a great high def TV. Only problem, their tv menu service was out of order the entire night we were there so no movie night as planned (not all bad, guess we saved $15.00 by not ordering a movie!). All in all a good hotel but needs to work out its "new" kinks before I would consider again. For a business traveler I'm sure its fine, but a family hotel or someone on a tighter budget definitely look elsewhere as everything is a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rm996s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. The hotel was pretty nice, the rooms are decent and were pretty clean. It is a relatively new hotel so it was modern and had a nice HDTV in the room. Great for watching football or other games if that is your thing. The views from here of the water are pretty nice. In the bottom of the hotel there is a Starbucks so you can get coffee in the morning. Also you can take a nice walk along the seaport. They are building a pedestrian walkway that will connect you right next to the Ballpark, once that is done it will be a bit better. But overall you are only a 5-10 min walk from the Gaslamp District for food and shopping. Bring your own water, it is like $4.50 in the room and vending machines want $3.50 for a drink. So I suggest you bring your own water and/or drinks. Self parking was $21.00 a night. Which is about the average rate for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Great Hotel - Already Going Back”
Reviews.Author: ajgator13
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick one night stay at this hotel on the Sunday of Labor Day weekend. We are just a short drive away from San Diego, as we live in Orange County - but love to come downtown and enjoy the night. We got this hotel Sunday morning at $84 a night (AAA Rate) - and I was sold! While it is a few steps further than the hotels IN the gaslamp quarter, this hotel was absolutely beautiful. We checked in, got a room with two queen beds, and went to OdySea (the bar) and enjoyed great drinks with a beautiful view of the Bay. The room was great, people complain about parking - but it is in downtown San Diego, $21 for the night is not much more than you would pay anywhere else down there. I loved that there is a Starbucks downstairs - I walked down in the morning to get some coffee. The beds are SO comfortable...nice flat screen LG TV...I have no complaints. For the price and the location - it can't be beat. It's much better than the more trendier hotels that can run you 199+ a night. Also, we didn't get a chance to enjoy the pool, but it is absolutely beautiful! We have already booked our stay to come back in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but extras can add up”
Reviews.Author: JandHQ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, modern, stylish, clean and very spacious. We have just returned from a 6 night stay and thoroughly enjoyed it. Ideally located, within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter with its many lively bars and restaurants, as well as many shops.
